Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We are rebels

IONLACE is a place for rebels. We are building the next generation of biotech tools that will ultimately impact the life of billions.

You will be joining a team from Google X, Enveda Bioscience, Thermo Fisher, KTH, Mila, and Oxford. You will be working at the cutting edge of machine learning and synthetic biology. We operate as a fast-paced startup with our office and lab at the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm. Join us and build the future.

About The Role

We are seeking an extraordinary Machine Learning Engineer to join our tech team. In this role you will be instrumental in developing cutting-edge machine learning models to push the forefront of digital biology. Your work will involve close collaboration with our interdisciplinary teams, combining insights from biochemistry and software development to create real-world impact.

You will have the opportunity to work on multimodal models, language models, graph neural networks, and other emerging modalities, all in the context of our own biological data. Your role will be pivotal in advancing our ML capabilities, ensuring that our solutions are not only technically sound but also aligned with our strategic goals. As a key member of our team, your expertise will be crucial in navigating the fast-paced and interdisciplinary nature of our work.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and enhance state of the art machine learning models, such as, protein language models and geometric ML models
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, including founders, biochemists, molecular biologists, data scientists, and fellow software developers.
Drive cutting-edge innovation and ensure best practices in ML development and implementation.


Qualifications


Advanced degree (PhD or equivalent experience) in Engineering, Natural Sciences, or a related field.
Proven experience in machine learning, particularly with language models and/or graph neural networks.
Strong programming skills, preferably in Python.
Experience with biological data is ideal, but not required.
Effective communication skills, able to work collaboratively with both technical and scientific teams.
Ability to own your work and drive outcomes in a fast-paced, interdisciplinary environment.


Benefits


Generous equity as part of your total compensation.
30 days vacation and 13 days of public holidays.
Premium pension contribution.
Large modern lab and office on the beautiful Karolinska Institute campus.


IONLACE is an equal opportunity employer and we actively seek to create a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of their background.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

What's it all about?

As Data Scientist, you are a key member of our growing Data Science function in the advisory service Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) and are part of Visa’s global Data Science community. In this role, you are be part of a team of data scientists that collaborates with management consultants, account executives, business development and other internal functions to support our clients’ with their most pressing issues and biggest opportunities. Your innovative and scalable solutions help drive our clients’ and Visa’s business performance as well as enhance payment experiences of millions of customers across the region.

What we expect day to day:

Are you an adept problem solver who applies both innovation and logic to solve complex problems? Would you like to leverage one of the largest payment behavioral data sets in the world to uplift everyone, everywhere? If so, this is what we are looking for you to do with us:


Designing and delivering powerful business-centric insights from data through storyboarding, analytics, visualization and/or ML with the guidance of Data Science project leads.
Collaborating with VCA consultants and key clients (e.g. issuing banks, acquiring banks, FinTechs, merchants). Understanding client challenges around payment and customer behaviour. Helping to solve them with data and insights.


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week, with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

What we’re after…

We are after motivated and curious, individuals with strong technical skills, and effective communication skills:


Team oriented, collaborative, agile working style
Experience in the application of descriptive analytics to business problems
Experience with Hadoop, SQL or Spark; Python or R
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to communicate with impact to other data scientists as well as non-technical stakeholders
Full working proficiency in English


What we'd love...


Experience working in the payments industry (bank, credit reference agencies, Fintech, merchants) or management-consulting firm
Experience of having worked in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles
Experience in the application of predictive modelling and machine learning technique to business problems
Full working proficiency in a Scandinavian language


Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Would you like to join a company at the forefront of transforming the electricity sector with its cutting-edge software-defined power system?




Our client is renowned for its groundbreaking innovations, including the world’s first miniature solid-state circuit breaker—a smart electronic device capable of quickly and safely interrupting the flow of electricity in case of an issue.




Job Description:

Our client is seeking a talented Data Scientist with a strong background in electrical engineering to join their dynamic team. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about revolutionizing the electrical power industry and is eager to apply their expertise in digital signal processing and machine learning to real-world challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement advanced data analysis and machine learning models to optimize and enhance the performance of electrical systems.
Utilize digital signal processing (DSP) techniques and fast Fourier analysis to analyze electrical signals.
Conduct feature engineering and circuit design and analysis to improve the reliability and efficiency of electrical components.
Apply general machine learning tools and frameworks, including TensorFlow Lite, to process and analyze data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate software and hardware solutions.
Contribute to the development and improvement of our client's software-defined power systems.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid understanding of electricity, voltage, current, motors, and batteries.
Proficiency in digital signal processing (DSP) and feature engineering.
Experience with fast Fourier analysis and circuit design and analysis.
Hands-on experience with machine learning tools and frameworks, particularly TensorFlow Lite.
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.




Electrical Engineering Skills:

Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Feature Engineering
Circuit Design and Analysis




Technical Skills:

Machine Learning
Fast Fourier Analysis
TensorFlow Lite




If you want to transform the future of electricity with innovative technology and cutting edge solutions, apply today!

Title: Data Scientist/ Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating reliable, scalable data platforms with cutting-edge technology. From GenAI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.

Unlock Exciting Opportunities as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer!

YOUR ROLE

Are you passionate about shaping the future through data-driven insights? Imagine a role where you collaborate with clients, unravel complex challenges, and drive meaningful impact. As a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of innovation, using a modern tech stack to transform businesses.

What You’ll Do


Data Alchemy: Dive into data wrangling, craft algorithms, and deploy solutions that matter and create insights.
Wide Horizons: From predicting amusement park visitors to optimizing direct marketing, your canvas is vast.
Cloud Magic: We’re all about Databricks and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).


YOUR PROFILE


Experience: You’ve polished your skills as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, but still feel eager to continue to grow and take on new challenges.
Python Wizardry: Pandas, Scikit, PyTorch—these are your allies.
Version Control: Git is your trusty sidekick.
SQL Savvy: You speak the language of databases.
Pedagogical Flair: Explain Data Science like a pro.
Academic Roots: Math, engineering, IT—your foundation matters.
Language Mastery: You speak Swedish and English fluently—essential for client interactions.


Bonus Points For


Generative AI: Unleash creativity.
Knowledge graphs: Neo4j is our go-to tool.
Databricks: Our secret sauce.
MLOps Champion: CI/CD, continuous training—your playground.
Stable Solutions: Kubernetes and Docker mastery.
Business Acumen: Beyond code, grasp the bigger picture.
Data Ecosystem: Know your Data Engineering and Business Intelligence.


What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here

We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.

At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.

Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Generative AI, Databricks and Microsoft Azure.

APPLICATION

Ready to shape the future? Feel free to ask for more details!

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
Show more
HTML:
Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating reliable, scalable data platforms with cutting-edge technology. From GenAI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.

Unlock Exciting Opportunities as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer!

YOUR ROLE

Are you passionate about shaping the future through data-driven insights? Imagine a role where you collaborate with clients, unravel complex challenges, and drive meaningful impact. As a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of innovation, using a modern tech stack to transform businesses.

What You’ll Do

  • Data Alchemy: Dive into data wrangling, craft algorithms, and deploy solutions that matter and create insights.
  • Wide Horizons: From predicting amusement park visitors to optimizing direct marketing, your canvas is vast.
  • Cloud Magic: We’re all about Databricks and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).

YOUR PROFILE

  • Experience: You’ve polished your skills as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, but still feel eager to continue to grow and take on new challenges.
  • Python Wizardry: Pandas, Scikit, PyTorch—these are your allies.
  • Version Control: Git is your trusty sidekick.
  • SQL Savvy: You speak the language of databases.
  • Pedagogical Flair: Explain Data Science like a pro.
  • Academic Roots: Math, engineering, IT—your foundation matters.
  • Language Mastery: You speak Swedish and English fluently—essential for client interactions.

Bonus Points For

  • Generative AI: Unleash creativity.
  • Knowledge graphs: Neo4j is our go-to tool.
  • Databricks: Our secret sauce.
  • MLOps Champion: CI/CD, continuous training—your playground.
  • Stable Solutions: Kubernetes and Docker mastery.
  • Business Acumen: Beyond code, grasp the bigger picture.
  • Data Ecosystem: Know your Data Engineering and Business Intelligence.

What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here

We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.

At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.

Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Generative AI, Databricks and Microsoft Azure.

APPLICATION

Ready to shape the future? Feel free to ask for more details!

It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. Title: Data scientist/Machine learning engineer
Description:
Job Description

Do you also want to make the world a little better while devoting yourself to cutting-edge technology development? Then Sigma Industry Development is the right company for you.

As a data scientist/machine learning engineer at Sigma Industry Development, you will:



Design solutions for distributed computing to handle large datasets
Develop domain expertise to better understand business problems and provide relevant solutions for the organization/client
Creating clear and effective visualizations to present findings through visualizations and reports to non-technical stakeholders; communicating complex findings in a clear and understandable manner
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, engineers, and decision-makers
Applying critical thinking to frame and solve complex problems
Adopting an iterative approach to problem-solving, refining models based on feedback
Understanding and adhering to data privacy and ethical considerations
Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance



And remember – besides the unlimited possibilities to engineer cutting-edge technology, you're an addition to our team; you become an integral part of the Sigma family, weaving your unique thread into the intricate tapestry of our company's path forward. Your presence holds the potential to shape our collective journey, infusing it with your skills and perspectives.

Welcome to the Sigma family. Your journey starts now, where each line of code etches a mark of your contribution on the canvas of our collective ambition.

Basic Qualifications

Education



B.Sc. or M.Sc in Computer Science or Applied Physics/Mathematics



Know-how



Data Analysis - Proficient in exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data patterns and trends.
Statistical Modeling - Designing and implementing statistical models to derive insights from data.
Hypothesis Testing - Conducting hypothesis testing to validate assumptions and make data-driven decisions.
Programming Languages - Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis; developing predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing - Cleaning and preprocessing raw data to prepare it for analysis.
Data Wrangling - Manipulating and transforming data into a suitable format for analysis.
Machine Learning and algorithm Selection - Selecting appropriate machine learning algorithms based on the nature of the problem.
Model Evaluation - Evaluating model performance using metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score
Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance
Hyperparameter Tuning - Optimizing model hyperparameters for better performance
Big Data Technologies - Familiarity with big data processing tools like Hadoop and Apache Spark
SQL and NoSQL Databases - Proficiency in working with both SQL (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB) databases.



Linguistics



Swedish and English (spoken and written)



Preferred Additional Skills, Personal Traits And Experience

You embody the spirit of a passionate team player, adept at fostering positive interactions through exceptional soft skills. What sets you apart is your unwavering enthusiasm for both professional growth and enjoyment in the process. Just as we do, you believe that learning should be a journey of discovery and excitement.

If the realm of AI holds a special place in your interests, consider it an added advantage. We're thrilled at the prospect of delving into the world of artificial intelligence alongside you. Together, we'll nurture and cultivate these skills, turning curiosity into expertise, and evolving with the ever-changing landscape of technology.

We offer

Sigma Industry Development offers you a platform to shape your future. A company where you can excel in your career and simultaneously contribute to the greater good.

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – a selection



https://starforlife.org/
https://expectabettertomorrow.com/
https://www.parasport.se/
https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council



Our core values are



Family identity – have fun together and show appreciation.
Teamplay – engage, learn, and give feedback.
Gender equality & equal treatment – we are all the same: humans.
Action – act to excel.



In Addition, Sigma Offers a Range Of Benefits



TGL Group Life Insurance
Cellphone and subscription
Additional life & accidents insurance
Occupational Pension scheme
Parental salary subsidy
Wellness contribution
Flexible working hours
Hybrid workplace



Apply today if you like to know more about Sigma Industry Development.

More information

To apply – Register your resume via our website (link in add). The recruitment process is continuously ongoing.

For further information please contact, Oscar Silversparf (oscar.silversparf@sigma.se).

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hello!

Welcome to eComID, a forward-thinking startup based in Stockholm, Sweden. Our mission is simple yet ambitious: to reduce product returns in the fashion industry. We combine cutting-edge technology with deep industry insights to create solutions that empower retailers and delight customers.

We’re a fast-growing company, having secured €2.75 million to expand our operations and innovate further. As we scale, we’re looking to grow our team with individuals who are passionate about making a tangible impact on the fashion industry.




About the role…

Depending on your profile and career development preference, the nature of your work will vary a bit between improving infrastructure, improving our current AI models, or developing new ones. Some missions examples could be:

Build the scalable infrastructure - needed for serving AI models across millions of customers.
Push forward the state of the art of AI models — improve quality of our models such as: dynamic pricing, LLM’s for ETL, size recommendations.
Streamline Machine Learning operations — such as a tools to automatically update our models, benchmark competitors or automate every-day tasks.
Improve the performance, reliability, and efficiency of our systems — for example finding bottlenecks in model inference, correctness in data pipelines
Tech stack - python, sklearn, pytorch, pandas, polars, clickhouse, postgres, go, fastapi, onnx




﻿

What you will bring…

You have 2+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer (or researcher) or you have 2+ years experience as a Software Engineer with ML knowledge.
You are passionate about stats/ml/deep learning, you are up-to-date with the latest research and you have strong foundations of the mathematics behind it.
You're product focused. You want to listen to customers, and build the product that will solve their needs.
Experience serving models at scale: You know how AI at scale works and design your models/pipelines in accordance.
You care about the business implications of anything you build. You don't go after the shiny stuff, but see it as a balance of craft, speed, and the bottom line.
You love steep learning curves, and are not afraid to learn about subjects that are outside of the comfort zone. For example, you can learn most technologies as you go. You're pragmatic about them, it's about the tools and tradeoffs, not ideologies.
You care about information security and design things with security in mind.
You’re a great mentor, able to share your knowledge and upskill other team members. Bonus points if you have experience helping a junior engineer stretch their skills and learn fast.







Apply

Contact: career@ecomid.com with subject “Machine Learning Engineer” or apply through linkedin

Show more

Title: Data Science/ML Engineer HealthTech
Description:
Do you want to be at the forefront of the fast growing Women’s Health movement? Hormona is a venture-backed, data-driven women’s health company located between London & Stockholm. We’re on a mission to revolutionise women’s health by helping women to take control of their hormones.

We’re a small and ambitious team looking for a Data Science/ Machine Learning Engineer with an eye for the details to navigate the future of Hormona. You’ll work hands-on across a wide variety of projects, from our AI-powered image processing feature to our data insights platform and lots in between.

Why work for us?

You will be exposed to one of the fastest growing sectors in the tech industry today. The Women’s Health industry is currently valued at USD 40 billion and doesn’t seem to be slowing down any time soon.

We are a small team of 12 people meaning you will get up close and personal with the ins and outs of our business. If you enjoy the flexibility and unique perspectives that a start up company has to offer, then you will definitely enjoy working for Hormona! We offer a flexible working environment where you can work from home when you need/prefer; but we always encourage you to come into the shared working spaces (London and Stockholm) as often as possible so that we can collaborate more effectively together.

Key Responsibilities


Design and build data-driven solutions to be integrated into the Hormona mobile app
Develop accurate predictive models and build processes to maintain and monitor the models in production
Develop Insights Data Warehouse and Platform
Design and analyse experiments with descriptive statistics
Advise on and maintain privacy compliant solutions within the company


Required Skills


Experience in developing and leading machine learning projects, preferably in a production environment
Strong experience in python (pandas, Scikit-learn, OpenCV, flask)
Strong experience using SQL and building data warehouses and pipelines (experience with DBT or Dataform a bonus)
Strong understanding of statistics and inference
Familiarity with version control systems (Git) and agile development methodologies
Autonomous and responsible, work well in a distributed team
An understanding of user experience and its importance in digital product development
Speak fluent English


Bonus Points For


Experience in startups
Interested in women’s health/Femtech industry


What we offer you


A friendly, curious, and international working environment with a small, ambitious team
Flexible working opportunities
Impact the future of the company
Office space with a hybrid opportunity
Fun meet-ups with the whole team around Europe
Play a big role in our mission to improve the future of female health
Growth opportunities
Competitive salary


Who are you?

You are self-aware, collaborative and have a positive character. You have a strong passion for the digitisation of healthcare with a belief in a preventative approach to health. You have a good understanding of what it takes to create something from nothing and have been a part of successful, scalable technical projects. You thrive in a fast-paced, data-driven and agile environment and you want to use your talent to help us on our mission to change the landscape of women’s health.

Ready to be the Data Science/ML Engineer we've been searching for? Apply now! 🚀
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. As a consultant with us, you'll enjoy a high salary, a generous benefits package, and the opportunity to work remotely. On average, our consultants increase their monthly pay by 44%. How is this possible?

The math is simple. We can pay you more because we cut costs on things that don't directly benefit you—no overpaid bosses, no expensive group conferences, and no big fancy offices. Instead, we invest in you, providing the trust and freedom you need to excel and compensating you accordingly. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.

Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody means:


Maximized compensation: Typically a +44% salary increase.
Higher sense of freedom: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who want.
Shaping the future: Work with digital game-changers like Mojang, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, and various startups and scale-ups.


About Us

Coody is a dynamic and growing team for the new generation in tech, with assignments in Sweden, Finland, and the UK. Our broad network includes customers in Gaming, AI, XR/VR, EV, MedTech, and FinTech sectors.

We think of ourselves as a community platform rather than a traditional company. We are building a seamless existence for our consultants, where trust is high, and micro-management is low. We cherry-picked the functions that actually benefit consultants and are proud to share our benefits stated in our employee handbook.

What You'll Be Doing

As a Data Scientist consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.

You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute in the full stack of data science projects.

You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

What We Are Looking For


5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist
Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
Fluency in English (verbal and written)
Experience working in an agile environment
A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE

A good track record working as a Data Scientist

Hands-on experience with at least a couple of production-level data science projects, from prototyping to deploying, maintaining and improving solutions

Deep knowledge of machine learning and statistics

Experience with some of the following: Python, SQL, Numpy, Pandas, R, TensorFlow

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field

If Gravity Free Consulting sounds like the perfect fit for you and your profile matches our needs, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

We will respond within a week if your profile aligns with our current requirements.
Show more

At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. As a consultant with us, you'll enjoy a high salary, a generous benefits package, and the opportunity to work remotely. On average, our consultants increase their monthly pay by 44%. How is this possible?

The math is simple. We can pay you more because we cut costs on things that don't directly benefit you—no overpaid bosses, no expensive group conferences, and no big fancy offices. Instead, we invest in you, providing the trust and freedom you need to excel and compensating you accordingly. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.

Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody means:

  • Maximized compensation: Typically a +44% salary increase.
  • Higher sense of freedom: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who want.
  • Shaping the future: Work with digital game-changers like Mojang, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, and various startups and scale-ups.

About Us

Coody is a dynamic and growing team for the new generation in tech, with assignments in Sweden, Finland, and the UK. Our broad network includes customers in Gaming, AI, XR/VR, EV, MedTech, and FinTech sectors.

We think of ourselves as a community platform rather than a traditional company. We are building a seamless existence for our consultants, where trust is high, and micro-management is low. We cherry-picked the functions that actually benefit consultants and are proud to share our benefits stated in our employee handbook.

What You'll Be Doing

As a Data Scientist consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.

You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute in the full stack of data science projects.

You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

What We Are Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist
  • Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
  • Fluency in English (verbal and written)
  • Experience working in an agile environment
  • A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done

WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE

A good track record working as a Data Scientist

Hands-on experience with at least a couple of production-level data science projects, from prototyping to deploying, maintaining and improving solutions

Deep knowledge of machine learning and statistics

Experience with some of the following: Python, SQL, Numpy, Pandas, R, TensorFlow

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field

If Gravity Free Consulting sounds like the perfect fit for you and your profile matches our needs, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

We will respond within a week if your profile aligns with our current requirements.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to work with customer data science teams, address end to end data science lifecycle and help them to see business value with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. As a data science specialist, you will focus on industry specific use cases, explain how to address business problems with cutting edge data science techniques, provide subject matter expertise and support while demonstrating the art of possible with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure using data science and machine learning techniques.

This role requires a strong ability to work with customer data science teams to solve complex problems and a collaborative mindset to drive success in a team-oriented environment. Deep technical expertise in advanced machine learning algorithms, a solid understanding of the data science lifecycle, and a proven track record of working on real data science problems are a must. The ideal candidate will have experience with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and possess a Master’s degree or higher. Collaboration will be a key characteristic of your work, both with customers and within Oracle, including with other Specialist teams and Product Management.

What You’ll Do:


Work closely with customer data science teams to understand their needs, provide insights, and help them solve specific business challenges.
Help customers design, develop, and implement advanced data science algorithms to solve complex data science and machine learning problems.
Analyze and interpret data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to key stakeholders across the organization.
Work closely with customers' cross-functional teams, including business users, data engineers, and data scientists, and address their requirements to deliver data-driven solutions.
Manage the entire data science lifecycle, from data collection and cleaning to model deployment and monitoring while working on customer problems or art-of-the-possible demo assets.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science, providing technical guidance and mentorship to team members.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in the data science world.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

What You’ll Bring:


Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in data science with a proven track record of leading successful data-driven projects.
Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and data analysis techniques.
Understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Proven experience working with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively
Experience working with customer data science teams to address and solve business problems.
Excellent teamwork and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, as well as experience with open-source tools and libraries like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.



A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Would you like to play a key part in Toca Boca’s Research and Insights Team? With over 60 million monthly active users and terabytes of daily data, in the role of a Data Scientist you will play an integral role in understanding and developing how our users engage with our games, helping to create fantastic play experiences for kids.

Our team is a unique blend of all player insights functions, namely data science, data engineering, business intelligence as well as market and user research.

We are open to both Senior and Mid Level applicants to this role, we encourage you to apply and we can talk about the set up in more details from there.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Data Scientist at Toca Boca you will work closely with our Stockholm game studios helping product teams for existing and upcoming games understand and improve how players engage with their games. By leveraging your data skills to analyse player behaviour and preferences you will help us create more engaging, fun, and rewarding gaming experiences, ensuring that our games not only meet but exceed the expectations of our millions of players.

You will closely collaborate with product teams to monitor game performance, offering actionable insights for prioritisation across your studios and games. With the game teams you design A/B tests and define their success criteria, ensure the availability of required data, carry out quantitative analysis to evaluate outcomes, and suggest optimisation steps.

Is this you?

You are a seasoned Data Scientist with solid experience working with both SQL and either Python or R for analytical coding. You have good knowledge of statistical distributions and statistical modelling, and can tailor your data visualisations for ad-hoc reporting as well as specialised dashboards.

You have stakeholder management experience, with a keen sense of product needs and the ability to listen, question, and translate requirements into data solutions while managing expectations across diverse groups. In your analyses you are good at balancing detail with the bigger picture.

You are a team player who is good at unblocking the team and driving a high standard for quality and ease of improvement.

You believe in the power of play!

This is us!

Play is in our DNA. At Toca Boca, we make playful, safe spaces where kids can have fun and feel free to be themselves. Over 60 million kids from all over the world play our games every month. Toca Boca World is our biggest game yet, with multiplayer game Toca Boca Days launching in select markets through 2024. Are you in? Let’s play.

Good to know!

This position is full-time and based in our Stockholm studio with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.

Title: Data Scientist, Support (GenAI)
Description:
Job Description

We're looking for an awesome someone to join our Support Group, the development organization that builds our in-house customer service tooling. They work on topics like support chat, operational tooling for support agents, and self-service and automation. We see great opportunities for applying machine learning and AI in this domain, and are now strengthening the data science team there.

We're looking for someone to work embedded in a cross-functional development team where the data scientists work together with engineers, designers, and product and analytics people owning that area and domain end to end. You would be contributing to projects that have visible business impact, owning the data science parts of the solution, and working through the whole lifecycle of the development process - from ideation to deployment and maintenance.

Potential work topics can range from developing co-pilot tools for our support associates and AI assistants for our customers with the latest AI technologies, to working on more traditional machine learning and optimization problems.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden.

Our humble expectations

What we hope from you is that you first and foremost identify yourself as a Data Science enthusiast. Solving problems and making a business impact via Data Science is what makes you jump for joy!


You have previous experience building Data Science, Machine Learning and AI solutions with a measurable impact. You understand how to build data products, and deeply care about the end user experience;
You also understand what it takes to build production-level ML and AI solutions. You have experience with real-time applications and large scale deployments, and can handle the entire life cycle of data science solutions from ideation to maintenance;
Deep understanding and experience with Machine Learning and AI, a solid understanding of Statistics, and experience and knowledge in NLP. Experience in working as a part of an engineering team, building solutions to complex problems with large scale and real-time requirements.
Interest towards LLMs and GenAI and their applications to solving problems in production.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Fernanda Prado (fernanda.prado.e.silva@wolt.com).

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Consumer
Description:
Job Description

About the Consumer Group

As the name Consumer Group implies, this group is responsible for building and developing Wolt’s consumer-facing products. The core mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in a pocket.

About The Consumer Data Science Team

Consumer Analytics team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists (Analytics) and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering team who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience that requires a good mix of technical and stakeholder engagement skills. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics or data science role. Data Scientists at Wolt take ownership of the business outcomes.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using data science skills to solve business problems, we're looking for someone like you.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent for product development (preferably consumer-facing).
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist - AI and Analytics
Description:
Are you able to transform raw data into valuable insights and have a strong business understanding? Then this is an excellent opportunity to join our AI team at the Stockholm office.




About the role

As a Data Scientist, you will develop our AI and analytics business by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, identifying new business opportunities and find innovative solutions to complex problems.




You will be exploring, planning, and building solutions for internal cross-functional teams and clients. We strongly believe in being part of the client’s team and daily operations to be able to make the biggest impact possible. Common use cases include applying models for clustering, classification and regression.




Your background

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Plus three years of experience in AI/ML
Extensive experience in Python programming and SQL
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow and PyTorch) and deep learning techniques.




It’s a plus if you also have…

Experience working with and managing stakeholders in complex projects. Preferably as a consultant.
Have at least one certificate for GCP or Azure at professional l
Experience of Marketing Mix Modeling, predictive CLV and audience segmentation
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills




What we offer

We have an exciting future planned for NoA Connect and strive to develop our brand together with our colleagues and the rest of the NoA-family. Our client list covers a broad variety of industries including fashion & beauty retail, telecom, food, communication, and banking. Examples of customers are Telia, SAS, Telia, Strawberry, Länsförsäkringar, Adidas and ACO.

The opportunity to develop your know-how, discuss customer needs, trends, and share knowledge with colleagues.
The possibility to combine working from home, the office and at client’s offices.
Respect for the personal situation and a healthy work/life balance
Great benefits such as pension contribution, wellness allowance and 30 days of paid vacation.
... and much more.




Our recruitment process

No need for a personal letter or a CV-document. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions - that's it. If you move forward to the next stage, we will use recruitment tests to ensure a fair selection based on your readiness for the role and your potential to grow with us.




To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. Therefore, as part of our recruitment process, we use Alva Labs assessments to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role.




About NoA Connect

NoA Connect is a data-driven marketing consultancy that unlocks growth by supporting marketing departments as they transition to deliver better brand experiences. Our objective is to enable our clients to reach their full digital potential and maximize their capabilities. To do so, our teams of experts, located in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Oslo, improve all aspects of our clients digital activities by understanding their process, both in terms of strategy as well as execution and measurement. We have a great scope of competence not only within NoA Connect but also in our other agencies that enables close work and dialog with, for example, Developers.




We handle applications on an ongoing basis.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.







We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.




As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be the right hand of the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will take fuzzy business goals and transform them into data science products that can deliver value iteratively. Leading the data science work in the team, you will be responsible for structuring the work and ensuring that the outcomes match the business objectives. A significant part of this leadership will be coaching and mentoring other data scientists to guide and speed their development, as well as unblocking them and finding ways to make the team as happy and productive as possible.

Collaboration is a central requirement for this role, both when working with stakeholders, but also within the team to deliver results that cannot be delivered by one person on their own




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals
Gathering, collating, and understanding the data necessary to create data science products that delight the customers
Collaborating with stakeholders throughout Truecaller to find and build data science products that solve business and customer problems at scale.
Coaching and mentoring junior to senior data scientists to improve their technical skills and productivity




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
A solid understanding of the engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:




A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, top-up parental leave, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership (SATS).
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 3 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a daily free breakfast, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, or have fun with your colleagues at the playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!




Come as you are:




Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Data Scientist - Game Economy
Description:
We are looking for a data scientist with a focus on game economy systems. You will play a critical role in designing, developing, and optimizing automated tools and simulations to enable and inform our team on economy designs & decisions.

You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, designers & other developers to provide the tooling needed to sustain a robust and growing in-game economy, which is a central part of the game.

Example Of Responsibilities


Build simulations that model various economic scenarios, allowing us to test and optimize in-game mechanics faster and more accurately.
Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to the in-game economy.
Provide insights and recommendations based on performance data to improve player experiences and revenue generation.
Enable designers by providing them with the necessary tools and data to balance in-game currencies, resources, and crafting mechanics.
Help ensure a balanced and engaging experience for our players.



We would love if you have


A creative and curious mind
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw actionable conclusions.
Experience building & running simulations of economies.
Proficiency in python or similar.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Passion for gaming and understanding of in-game economies is a plus.
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vill du jobba i ett företag med både hjärta och hjärna som satsar mycket på IT? Vill du forma innovativa och smarta IT- och AI-lösningar i agila team som skapar trygghet och värde för våra kunder? Just nu fokuserar vi på digitalisering av kundmötet, utveckling av morgondagens försäkringssystem och förflyttning mot publika molntjänster.




Datadomänen söker nu en Machine Learning Engineer till Skanstull i Stockholm som vill vara med på Folksams moln- och AI-resa.




Det här gör du som Machine Learning Engineer på Folksam

I rollen som ML Engineer inom Datadomänen spelar du en central roll i Folksams pågående moln- och AI-resa.




Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella agila team. Ditt arbete fokuserar på utveckling och implementering av AI -och maskininlärningslösningar. Du kommer att använda en rad olika verktyg och plattformar som exempelvis Azure Databricks, MLFlow, DevOps-pipelines för att hantera ML-applikationer från idé till produktionssättning. Arbetet innebär även nära samarbete med representanter från affärssidan för att undersöka och realisera olika initiativ inom AI/ML.




Nyfiken på att veta mer vad en Machine Learning Engineer jobbar med på Folksam? Gå in och läs här!




Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker en självgående individ med ett genuint intresse för maskininlärning. Du har antingen redan arbetat inom AI/ML, eller så är du ivrig att fördjupa dig och lära dig mer inom dessa spännande områden. Du älskar att lära dig nya saker och trivs i en miljö där du kan arbeta nära verksamheten. Vi är ett engagerat, tvärfunktionellt team som brinner för AI, och vi värdesätter kontinuerligt lärande och delat ansvar.




Vi ser att du som söker har:

En högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, maskininlärning, systemvetenskap, eller en liknande ingenjörsutbildning.
Kunskap inom AI och maskininlärning.
Goda programmeringskunskaper, gärna i Python.
Flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.




Följande är meriterande, men kan ersättas av nyfikenhet och viljan att lära dig:

Erfarenhet kring stora språkmodeller och vektordatabaser.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Microsoft Azure eller annan molnbaserad plattform.
Praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps och CI/CD.
Bekant med Openshift, Databricks och MLFlow.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med REST-API:er.

Du är naturligtvis nyfiken på ny teknik, älskar att lösa problem, är innovativ och tänker utanför givna ramar. Du är en lagspelare som gillar att samarbeta med andra och är alltid redo att testa nya saker.




Utvecklas tillsammans med oss

Folksam är ett kundägt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhetsfrågor. Vi har många roliga, utvecklande jobb och hos oss har du goda chanser till en spännande karriär med bra förmåner. Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Vi erbjuder flexibiliteten att varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån utifrån verksamhetens behov. Våra trevliga kontor runt om i landet ger mötesplatser för samarbete, lärande och en gemensam kultur – tillsammans skapar vi engagemang och kraft framåt! På folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar kan du läsa mer och se filmer om hur det är att jobba på Folksam.




Så söker du jobbet

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 18 augusti 2024. På grund av semesterperioden så kommer urvalsarbetet påbörjas vecka 34.




Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Jan Svanholt på 072-163 50 48. Alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonseringshjälp undanbedes.




Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson, 073-423 59 12 och Handels Mikael Karlsson 070-831 51 32.




Folksamgruppen erbjuder försäkringar och långsiktigt sparande som skapar trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi är cirka 4 000 medarbetare och vår vision är att våra kunder ska känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld. Vi engagerar oss i det våra kunder bryr sig om och är måna om att de är rätt försäkrade.

Show more

Title: AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more
