Title: Data Scientist för samhällsbyggnad och fastighetsbranschen
Description:
Fastighetsloggen växer och nu söker vi dig som vill hjälpa oss att bygga bolaget vidare genom att vidareutveckla tjänsten med all den data vi sitter på.




Vad gör vi på Fastighetsloggen? Vi är ett teknikföretag (SaaS) i tillväxtfas inom fastighets-, finans- & klimatdata. Den gemensamma faktorn är fastigheter och en passionerad vision om att hjälpa konsulter, fastighetsägare, banker och fonder att öka transparens samt övergången till en mer hållbar industri.




Våra kunder idag är en blandning av banker, fastighetsbolag, konsulter - stora som små. Vi jobbar efter våra tydliga kärnvärden som formar bolaget och hur vi går tillväga: ödmjukhet, transparens och nyfikenhet. Produktens fokus är att samla allt på ett ställe, tänk dig ett CRM för fastigheter. Vår fokus ligger på fastighetsdata, bolagsinformation, demografisk information, miljö & klimat samt taxonomi-relaterade utmaningar.




Vi söker en skarp och analytisk Data Scientist med programmeringskunskaper till vårt dynamiska team. I rollen kommer du att arbeta med att analysera och hitta mönster i komplex data som är relaterad till samhällsbyggnad, klimat, miljö, fastigheter, demografi och finansiell information inom fastighetsbranschen.




Ansvarsområden:

Analysera stora datamängder för att identifiera trender och mönster
Utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer
Programmera i språk som Python, R eller liknande för dataanalys och modellutveckling
Samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att förstå deras databehov och leverera insiktsfulla analyser
Visualisera data och presentera resultat för interna och externa intressenter
Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras affärslogik och utmaningar
Hjälpa kunderna att implementera data-drivna lösningar som förbättrar deras verksamhet







Kvalifikationer:
Examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik eller liknande område
Gedigen erfarenhet av programmering i Python, R eller liknande språk
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataanalys och maskininlärning
Stark analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder
Förmåga att kommunicera komplexa tekniska koncept på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt
Erfarenhet av samhällsbyggnad, klimat, miljö eller fastighetsbranschen är meriterande
Show more

Title: Pricing Data Scientist
Description:
Since you’ve landed on this page, you already know Hedvig is a mover and shaker in insurtech, and think you might have what it takes to join us. As the only loved insurance company in Sweden (in the world?). We’ve been working hard since the very beginning to change an industry that is hard to love – to something at least likable. At Hedvig, we believe the only way to do so is to work with loveable people.




What about the role?

Do you have experience from the insurance industry or possibly, in some cases, the bank industry - we might be looking for YOU! Have a look at the role described below.




We are now looking for a Pricing Data Scientist to join our ambitious team at Hedvig. As a Pricing Data Scientist, you will develop and maintain machine learning models that calculate fair prices for our insurances. Working closely with Backend Developers, ML Engineers, Data Analysts and the rest of the pricing team, you will have the opportunity to shape and use the data and tools that fuel our innovative pricing. This offers an inspiring freedom in what you will be able to create. You will also contribute to and develop our whole data stack in GCP using tools such as Fivetran, dbt, Vertex AI and Looker.




Responsibilities include but are not limited to:




- Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to offer fair prices

- Drive pricing projects to from raw data to deployed model and tracking of performance

- Design, build and test data models that reflect our business processes and objectives, mainly for pricing

- Contribute to building and enhancing our data infrastructure that will not only serve our 100,000+ customers but also everyone who works at Hedvig

- Be part of testing ideas and hypotheses using our tools and machine learning

- Support and collaborate with other developers to form and optimize processes for collecting, testing, and governing data across the data stack

- Evangelize the power of data by promoting your work to the team and stakeholders.

- Be a guiding star, always on the lookout for new trends within data and pricing




What about you?

- You have 2-5 years of experience from working with insurance pricing or other relevant field

- You have a University degree in engineering or have acquired similar knowledge elsewhere

- You are a skilled Python Developer with focus on machine learning

- You feel empowered by working in an end-to-end modern data stack with tools like BigQuery. dbt, Looker, etc.

- You are comfortable with transforming data using SQL

- You consider yourself a coder and understand that treating data as code is a no-brainer and requires testing, source control, and an agile way of working

- As a data evangelist you enjoy collaborating and sharing your knowledge in the team

- You are curious, well structured and a self starter

- You are fluent in English




Those are not hard requirements! If you have a different profile but you see that you have relevant skills and you think you can do a remarkable job, apply and share with us your motivation on why we should meet you.




What about us?

As part of the Hedvig team, you quickly notice that "general truths" are not accepted without being questioned. We're an enthusiastic group of people who love to challenge each other to find the best way forward. We don't care who says something; we care about what's being said. We put a lot of effort into building a trusting culture where freedom, collective thinking, and individual ownership have center stage. We're not perfect – far from it – but we talk about and learn from our mistakes and imperfections to improve continuously. And we have a lot of fun along the way! As individuals, as a team, and as a company.




Come join the Hedvig team, including all of our very loved office pups, in newly renovated offices in central Stockholm.

Show more
HTML:
Since you’ve landed on this page, you already know Hedvig is a mover and shaker in insurtech, and think you might have what it takes to join us. As the only loved insurance company in Sweden (in the world?). We’ve been working hard since the very beginning to change an industry that is hard to love – to something at least likable. At Hedvig, we believe the only way to do so is to work with loveable people.


What about the role?

Do you have experience from the insurance industry or possibly, in some cases, the bank industry - we might be looking for YOU! Have a look at the role described below.


We are now looking for a Pricing Data Scientist to join our ambitious team at Hedvig. As a Pricing Data Scientist, you will develop and maintain machine learning models that calculate fair prices for our insurances. Working closely with Backend Developers, ML Engineers, Data Analysts and the rest of the pricing team, you will have the opportunity to shape and use the data and tools that fuel our innovative pricing. This offers an inspiring freedom in what you will be able to create. You will also contribute to and develop our whole data stack in GCP using tools such as Fivetran, dbt, Vertex AI and Looker.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


- Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to offer fair prices

- Drive pricing projects to from raw data to deployed model and tracking of performance

- Design, build and test data models that reflect our business processes and objectives, mainly for pricing

- Contribute to building and enhancing our data infrastructure that will not only serve our 100,000+ customers but also everyone who works at Hedvig

- Be part of testing ideas and hypotheses using our tools and machine learning

- Support and collaborate with other developers to form and optimize processes for collecting, testing, and governing data across the data stack

- Evangelize the power of data by promoting your work to the team and stakeholders.

- Be a guiding star, always on the lookout for new trends within data and pricing


What about you?

Title: Innovation Impact Program - R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 47.000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Adhesive Technologies help to transform entire industries and provide our customers with a competitive advantage through adhesives, sealants and functional coatings. With our trusted brands, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.

Dare to make an impact?

Your Role


As a data scientist in our R&D team in Duesseldorf, Germany, you will partner with product developers and application engineers during your rotation to understand different technologies, data collection processes, and challenges that drive digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, building and deploying machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes, optimizing R&D procedures
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to communicate data insights to stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to enhance the understanding of digital tools and data-based decision-making within R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


YOUR SKILLS


You have completed or are about to complete a Master’s or Ph.D. in Chemistry, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or any hybrid studies. Ideally, your background combines one of these disciplines with material sciences to bridge the gap between theoretical and applied data science in a laboratory research and development setting
You are genuinely interested in R&D and different laboratory technologies and are eager to learn and understand various chemical skills and product development processes
You have experience in data analysis and modeling, preferably in a scientific or engineering environment, with a strong understanding of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data analysis tools (e.g., Python, R) and the design of experiment tools such as Minitab and JMP, and have experience with data visualization tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and, ideally, more advanced platforms
Ideally, you bring knowledge or experience in advanced technologies such as IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)
Customer satisfaction is key to you; you understand the importance of building strong relationships with stakeholders and are ready to offer creative solutions
You are open to relocation and embracing new challenges, with a willingness to explore diverse post-program career opportunities across our global Innovation network
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds


PROGRAM DETAILS

The program starts on November 1, 2024, at our Inspiration Center in Duesseldorf, Germany. We provide full relocation support to ensure a smooth transition. Upon completing the program after 18 months, you are encouraged to explore exciting career opportunities at Henkel’s global locations, e.g., Ireland, USA, India, China, and many more. We believe in nurturing talent globally and supporting your career aspirations wherever they may take you.

Join us and embark on a journey of innovation and growth, making a significant impact on a digital and sustainable future. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic team!

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 100 highly skilled professionals.




Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?




The role:

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.




You will be reporting to our CTO and Head of AI Product.




Who You Are:

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.




You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Continuously optimize AI models and algorithms for efficiency and scalability.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Provide guidance and mentorship to AI ambassadors in the organization, fostering their growth, development, and contribution to AI use in their respective departments.




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proven experience with generative AI.
Please provide sources to your work in your application - You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Interest in both open-source AI frameworks, libraries as well as closed-source projects, having contributed is a strong plus.
Proficiency in machine learning techniques, frameworks, big data, and programming languages.
Proficiency in Swedish




What we offer

Hybrid/remote work environment - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.




Location

We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. The product development team you will work with is in Stockholm, and the ability to spend face-to-face time with them is important.




Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

Show more

Excited?

Title: Lead machine learning engineer
Description:
About Napper

Napper is a fast-growing startup building AI-powered digital experiences to improve child sleep and strengthen the bond between parent and child. The Napper app has been used by more than one million parents around the world and has more than 20,000 five-star reviews. The app is frequently featured on the App Store as an Editors’ Choice app, and has been App of the Day in most European countries.




Our vision is ambitious; crafting and launching AAA-products that serve as essential digital partners for parents in their everyday life. Leveraging the latest technology combined with emphatic, human-centered design, we are scaling to become a household name for all families, everywhere. Our mission is to make sure each parent goes to bed at night feeling like the best parent in the world.




We are backed by some of Sweden’s most prominent angel investors and two international top-tier VC firms. That being said, we are also cash flow positive.




How we work

We are a tight group of talented (arguably), fun (subjectively) and creative (definitively) people pushing the boundaries of product and business development. We are ambitious, but more importantly curious.  We ask questions. We try things. We ideate and iterate. And sometimes, we even argue. Because we feel for the things we build. 




But most of all, we support each other. We laugh a lot. And we strive to make sure every person is really looking forward to coming into the office, every day. However, we also value freedom highly, and will cater to your needs whenever you need work to be flexible.




What we look for

You are a driven engineer who is excited to be part of our journey scaling Napper. You learn fast and are not afraid to take on new technical challenges. You actively seek responsibility and get motivated by complex problems and big tasks. You are looking for a job where you can advance your career fast and get well compensated for the hard work you put in. You love working with data and machine learning, and find joy in creating outstanding user experiences.




Our philosophy is to hire selectively and invest heavily in the people who work with us. If you become one of us - we’ll go above and beyond to make sure you find your work meaningful, inspiring, and stimulating, and feel fully supported by both your peers and superiors. We will evaluate your performance quarterly and re-negotiate your salary twice a year.




What you will be doing

You will work hand in hand with the CTO and CEO on developing production-ready features using machine learning. Leading ML engineering at Napper, you will own the full machine learning lifecycle, from developing data pipelines for hundreds of millions of baby sleep logs to applying the latest research to improve our sleep prediction engine. During product development, you will bring the data perspective and identify unique opportunities that can be achieved using your experience in machine learning. We don't believe in micromanagement – you'll have the freedom to tackle challenges with your creative solutions and problem-solving expertise. 




Requirements

4+ years of experience working with data engineering and machine learning
Demonstrable experience in leading machine learning projects from start to finish.
Proficiency in Python, SQL and widely used machine learning and data engineering libraries (PyTorch, PySpark, Scikit-learn etc.) 
Team player who can work independently and proactively propose solutions when faced with ambiguous software engineering problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills




Nice to have

Experience with AWS and infrastructure as code




What are you waiting for? We’d love to hear from you!

Show more

Leading ML engineering at Napper, you will own the full machine learning lifecycle, from developing data pipelines for hundreds of millions of baby sleep logs to applying the latest research to improve our sleep prediction engine. During product development, you will bring the data perspective and identify unique opportunities that can be achieved using your experience in machine learning. We don't believe in micromanagement – you'll have the freedom to tackle challenges with your creative solutions and problem-solving expertise. 


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience working with data engineering and machine learning
  • Demonstrable experience in leading machine learning projects from start to finish.
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL and widely used machine learning and data engineering libraries (PyTorch, PySpark, Scikit-learn etc.) 
  • Team player who can work independently and proactively propose solutions when faced with ambiguous software engineering problems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Nice to have

  • Experience with AWS and infrastructure as code


What are you waiting for? We’d love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
BrightBid is a rapidly growing AdTech company using the best of AI and human expertise to create Google Ads recommendations for businesses and help drive customer acquisition. Combined with BrightBid’s marketing and sales expertise, its AI- and human-led offering enables companies to compete, seeing at least a 35% increase in results on average. Founded in 2020, BrightBid is well in the top 10% of the fastest-growing SaaS companies globally and has achieved over 500,000 conversions for its 400+ customers.




We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm within the Data & AI team.




As a Senior Data Scientist at BrightBid, you will play a pivotal role in developing advanced algorithms and models to enhance and automate our platform further.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement ML algorithms to optimize ad targeting, bidding strategies, performance prediction.
Become a key contributor and tech lead for our Generative AI solutions in order to empower our Ad platform with powerful and relevant text automations at scale.
Lead the deployment of your models into production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate the effectiveness of your models within relevant statistical frameworks.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers, to integrate our AI solutions seamlessly into our platform.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and innovations in ML and Generative AI, ensuring BrightBid remains at the forefront of AI technologies.




What we are looking for:

In addition to an appetite to work with the above responsibilities, the ideal candidate will have a successful track record within at least some of the following areas:

4+ years in developing and deploying ML models in a production environment [required]
Good knowledge of software development practices such as versioning, CI/CD, etc. [required]
Proficiency with Python and standard ML libraries, algorithms and frameworks (Scikit-learn, PyTorch/Tensorflow).
Large Language Models (OpenAI’s GPT, LLaMA or other open-source or fine-tuned models) used at scale in a production environment.
Collaborative work in a fast-paced startup environment, contributing to a positive and innovative team culture.
AdTech, real-time bidding, or e-commerce companies.




Why BrightBid:

A fast-paced company with a yearly growth of 400% since its foundation.
We are open in 4 different markets: Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and London.
Wellness allowance.
All the tools you need to succeed in this role, Macbooks, monitors and more if necessary!
Hybrid working place.
Afterworks and kickoffs with the team.
Free breakfast at the office.
A fantastic team with high energy!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist | Shared Tech
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

Senior Data Scientist

Your role within our Kingdom:

This role sits within our Experimentation Platform Team, which is a mixed team consisting of circa 5-7 Data Scientists/Engineers and Software Engineers. As our new Senior Data Scientist you will be reporting into and collaborating with the Engineering Manager of the team, where you’ll play a pivotal role to help us to further our Experimentation Platform and be part of a community of 100+ data science & analytics experts in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment!

Specifically, you’ll:


Drive and design robust AB testing features in our experimentation platform
Collaborate with product managers, technical directors and other partners to define experimentation goals and requirements
Provide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work on
Optimise experimentation processes and workflows to improve efficiency and reliability with the business users in mind
Participate in code reviews, information sharing sessions, and multi-functional meetings to champion a culture of collaboration and learning
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and standard methodologies in AB testing and experimentation


Skills to create thrills:

Our ideal candidate will have solid experience working with technical projects in an analytical team in a commercial environment. There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are useful to excel in this role include:


AB testing expertise: The ability to design, implement, and analyze AB tests to better understand player interactions and optimize their experience within our games
Collaboration management: The ability to recognise dependencies, form relationships and influence others
Business insight: The ability to recognise the real problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions
Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting results/analysis so they are clear, rigorous and unambiguous
SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with over a billion players and work with relational database systems
Analytical coding: Using tools such as R or Python for analytical purposes
Software engineering skills: The ability to participate in software development methodologies and design. Or if not, a keen interest in doing so.


!

Other experience that might be useful, but is not required, includes:


Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)
Deep knowledge of different AB testing methodologies such as Sequential and Bayesian.
Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design
Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
Work in the games industry or similarly customer-facing digital businesses


About King

At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?

Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.

So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com
Show more

Title: Senior Product Data Scientist | Candy Crush
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

Senior Product Data Scientist

We are looking for a versatile and creative Product Data Scientist interested in building, defining and pushing the boundaries of game analytics and AB test analysis! You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioral or economic, in order to generate value for the mobile games we create here at King.

Candy Crush Saga is one of the world’s most popular mobile games. Millions of players around the globe match colourful candies in combinations of three or more to win points, defeat obstacles and progress through more than 15,000+ levels. In November 2022, Candy Crush Saga celebrated its 10-year anniversary. Candy Crush Saga is available to download for free from the Apple App Store, Google Play, Amazon App store, Windows App Store and Facebook.

Your Role

You’ll help us to further understand, segment, predict and retain our players. We want you to be part of our Candy Crush Core Gameplay Team, which is a cross-functional team consisting of other Data Scientists, Product Managers, Game Designers and Developers, where you’ll be tasked to drive the analytical side of the game, collaborating with the broader group!

Specifically, you’ll:


Design, monitor, analyze and communicate results for AB tests
Translate business needs to technical and AB test requirements, then work with development teams to ensure correct implementation and event tracking
Work closely with game designers and product team to scope and design tests to identify potential opportunities (e.g. player behavior, game economy)
Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to harness business opportunities
Carefully check and problem solve issues to ensure the correct operations of the game, even when confronted by subtle data complications
Provide a business analytical perspective to discussions and help to drive the priorities within your game
Champion data literacy within the cross-functional game team, and share your knowledge with the wider Data Science community


Skills to create thrills:

You have a passion for quantitative analysis, understanding player behaviour and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You are able to learn quickly and have worked in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Producers and Game Artists, so broad interpersonal skills are critical.

You need to be proficient in the following key skills:


Product insight: You are capable of using data to gain deep understanding of game mechanics and impacts on player behavior to solve business problems such as: feature implementation and optimizations, player economy optimization, main critical metric shift, tracking bugs, marketing impact.
Data Storytelling: You understand how to communicate, visualize and report your findings in a clear and unambiguous way to people with diverse degrees of numerical proficiency.
Technical skills: You can extract, manipulate and visualize the data and you have an understanding of applied statistics (probability, causality and time series). We make intensive usage of SQL, cloud services and the Python/R analytical stack, so having prior experience in at least two of these domains is definitely a plus.


There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific prior experience that might be useful, but is not required, includes:


Experience in the games industry or customer-facing digital businesses
Behavioral psychology/economics/game theory
Working knowledge of randomized controlled trials (ex: social science research, medical research, biostatistics, policy research etc.) or digital A/B testing and online controlled experiments
Experience with an experimentation platform or with conversion rate optimization (CRO) for Apps
Software engineering skills
Standard reporting tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc.
Cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery


About King

At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?

Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.

So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.

Title: Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, AI/ML & Analytics
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on an end-to-end data analytics and mlops solution composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on workflow, ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so we can accommodate candidates in almost any location. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hourse! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like


Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions


What we are looking for in you


Professional or academic software delivery using Python or Golang
Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have



The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.


Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions for the cloud.
Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Working knowledge of cloud computing
Passionate about software quality and testing
Experience working on an open source project


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so we can accommodate candidates in almost any location. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hourse! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like

  • Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
  • Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
  • Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
  • Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
  • Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
  • Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
  • Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions

What we are looking for in you

  • Professional or academic software delivery using Python or Golang
  • Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
  • Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
  • The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
  • Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
  • Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long

Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have



The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.

  • Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
  • Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions for the cloud.
  • Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
  • Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
  • Working knowledge of cloud computing
  • Passionate about software quality and testing
  • Experience working on an open source project

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Position Type

Full time

Type Of Hire

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired

Bachelor of Computer Science

Travel Percentage

0%

Junior Software Engineer

Location~ Stockholm, Sweden

FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.

The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform (formerly Front Arena) helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.

Your role As a Junior Software Engineer in the Workflow team, you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks. You will be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of PRIME – a client application within the FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform. The Workflow team is responsible for the development of trade entry frameworks and applications, workflows for life-cycle events and back-office operations. The development is typically done using C++, Python, and other native techniques.

We believe you are a Software Engineer with some experience in developing software in C or C++ (or equivalent). You are keen on taking responsibility for your own development. Your responsibilities will, besides development, include automated testing, support assistance and maintenance.

We will offer you stimulating challenges, where understanding customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an agile team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. We believe that the best solutions are built by those who are proud of what they produce! By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs and software design. Position requirements

We strongly believe that passion for financial markets and software development are equally necessary! We know that we can accomplish a lot more together than as individuals so are you a creative, passionate and a caring team player?

We Expect You To Have The Following


Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or similar degree
0-3 years of experience in system development
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming
Experience with C/C++ and Python is an advantage
Knowledge and interest in financial mathematics
Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment
Fluent English


In Addition To This We Believe That You


Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development
Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved
Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others
Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset
Have interest/experience in agile methodologies and software test automation


What we offer you At FIS, we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase

In Our Continued Journey. We Believe In Creating a Workplace Where Ideas Can Flow Freely And Where Every Day Is Different. A Career At FIS Is More Than Just a Job. We Offer


A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations
An informal and inclusive culture where we 'Win as a team' and care for each other
A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
Competitive salary and benefits package


Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Title: Junior Engineer
Description:
Vilka är vi?

Vi är ett rekryteringsbolag som hjälper juniora ingenjörer hitta rätt jobb från början. Vi har stenkoll på arbetsmarknaden och hjälper dig välja ett arbete som passar din kompetens, potential och personlighet. Detta för att du inte ska behöva slösa bort din tid på krångliga anställningsprocesser.




Vad vi erbjuder:

Via oss blir du en del av ett nätverk samt får extra utbildning och coachning under din första tid på din nya arbetsplats. Via vårt program Xamera Talent får du dessutom den perfekta balansen mellan trygghet och utmaningar. Vi ger dig möjlighet att vara ny på jobbet samtidigt som den personliga och professionella utvecklingskurvan går stadigt uppåt. Talangprogrammet ger verktygen och resurserna för att låsa upp din fulla potential och förmåga med soft skills i fokus.

Vi gör juniora medarbetare seniora lite snabbare!




Vi söker dig som:

Är högskole- eller civilingenjör inom exempelvis datateknik, maskinteknik, teknisk fysik och elektroteknik och ska ta din examen till sommaren. Ansök om ett karriärsamtal med en av våra rekryterare så ser vi till att du hamnar rätt efter examen!

Title: Product Analyst / Data Scientist
Description:
scilla.studio är ett gäng konsulter som hjälper bolag att växa genom att snabbt öka användarvärdet i produkten och att optimera hur produkten byggs för att den ska få stor spridning. Det gör vi med hjälp utav beteendeanalys, att validera hypoteser med hjälp utav A/B-tester samt lång erfarenhet inom produktutveckling. Som ett led i det letar vi efter en till datatung person.




OBS Vi kommer att börja hålla intervjuer i mitten på augusti, men skicka gärna din ansökan idag!




Vad du kommer syssla med:

Hos oss kommer du bland annat stötta våra kunder med insikter om hur användarna beter sig i deras digitala produkter och tjänster. Samt bidra med hypoteser som kan förbättra användarupplevelsen och bidra till produktens förmåga att aktivera och behålla användare.




Förutom att vi är konsulter utför vi experiment kring egna produktidéer. Här kan vi ta ut svängarna ordentligt och testa olika typer av idéer och validera potential utifrån data.




Vem du är:

Har du jobbat med dataanalys och märkt hur intressant det är att förstå hur användarna beter sig och hur det påverkar affären? Eller gillar du att gräva efter data i verktyg som till exempel Amplitude, Mixpanel eller BigQuery? I så fall är det här en roll för dig.




För att trivas i den här rollen tror vi att du:

Kan SQL, Python, och/eller R.
Gillar och förstår statistik.
Kan ta komplex data till modeller och analysera den.
Är en hejare på att kommunicera och få stakeholders att förstå dina findings
Vet hur du ska ställa relevanta frågor, då du har erfarenhet av research (t.ex. kvalitativ/kvantitativ).
Har jobbat i ett eller flera tvärfunktionellt team.
Erfarenhet av att sätta upp och arbeta med KPI-ramverk
Du är en nyfiken person och är intresserad nya arbetssätt, produkter och teknologier.




Meriterande, men inget krav:

Konsulterfarenhet.
Du är strategisk. Hos oss betyder det att du kan lyfta blicken och se helheten, mer än detaljen som du jobbar med.
Du gillar och är intresserad av facilitering.
Att ha lett team.
Erfarenhet av att presentera insikter till stakeholders/management team.
Arbetat med datadrivna arbetssätt.




Om scilla.studio

Vi är ett gäng snälla produktnördar som huserar i ett kontor vid Slussen med Stockholms bästa utsikt. Vi älskar data, att validera hypoteser och göra digitala tjänster mer användarvänliga.




scilla.studio har funnits i 3,5 år och vi har jobbat med kunder som till exempel SVT, Plick, ICA, Lassie, Tradera, Bambuser, Bannerflow, Mentimeter och AIRA.




På scilla.studio är det viktigt att att ta ansvar, att vilja utveckla sig själv och andra. Vi är ett tight team där alla bidrar med sin del och påverkar scilla.studio som bolag.




Vi har en podd som heter Datadrivet, där kan du höra mer om våra områden och vad vi gillar att fokusera på.




OBS Vi kommer att börja hålla intervjuer i mitten på augusti, men skicka gärna din ansökan idag!

scilla.studio har funnits i 3,5 år och vi har jobbat med kunder som till exempel SVT, Plick, ICA, Lassie, Tradera, Bambuser, Bannerflow, Mentimeter och AIRA.

Vi har en podd som heter Datadrivet, där kan du höra mer om våra områden och vad vi gillar att fokusera på.

Title: Junior Software Developer
Description:
Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.

Din roll

Brinner du för mjukvaruutveckling och drivs av att utveckla lösningar till komplexa system? Just nu söker vi två juniora Software Developer till vårt team som utvecklar säkra, mjukvarubaserade IP-nätverkselement till integrerade kommunikationslösningar främst för militär tillämpning. Kommunikationslösningarna spänner över flertalet teknologier så som radio, satellitlänk och IP-nätverk.

I rollen som Software Developer kommer du att utveckla, integrera och verifiera IP-nätverkselement. Detta omfattar mjukvaruutveckling, kravanalys och verifiering av mjukvara på funktions- och systemnivå.

Din profil

Vi söker dig som är en proaktiv och pålitlig lagspelare med god kommunikationsförmåga. Du har en gedigen teknisk bakgrund inom mjukvara, ett starkt intresse för kommunikationsteknik och ett mindset av att leverera kvalitet framför kvantitet. Du är nyfiken och håller dig uppdaterad på ny teknik, delar med dig av din kompetens till dina teamkamrater och bidrar i kunskapsöverföring, dokumentation och informationsdelning.

Som person behöver du vara driven, självständig och intresserad av att utvecklas vidare, samtidigt som du prestigelöst bidrar till teamet och hjälper till där det behövs. Du kommer att vara en del av ett mångsidigt team där allas åsikter och idéer är välkomna och där kollegialt stöd och hjälp alltid finns till nära hands. Det är viktigt för oss att du delar dessa värderingar då vi ser det som en förutsättning för vårt teams långsiktiga utveckling.

För den här rollen tror vi att nedan personliga egenskaper är viktiga:


Eftergymnasial utbildning i relevant område inom Software & Computer Engineering
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i utvecklingsprojekt där den detaljerade kravbilden inte alltid är helt klar



Vi söker primärt en person med kunskaper inom Python. Nedan teknikområden är också önskvärda:


Programspråk så som P4, C, C++, Java, Java script
Linux, Yocto
Erfarenhet av att utveckla med Open Source-mjukvara
Software Defined Networking
Information Assurance och cybersäkerhet
Virtualisering
Förståelse för interaktion mellan mjukvara och hårdvara
Behörighet för elarbete är meriterande



Uppdraget utförs på plats i Saabs lokaler.

Befattningen kräver genomgång och godkännande enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan medföra krav på svenskt medborgarskap.

Vad du blir en del av

Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.

Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.

Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.

Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

Vänligen observera att urvalsarbetet i rekryteringsprocessen kommer att påbörjas i augusti månad, men vi tar gärna emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
Show more

  • Erfarenhet av att arbeta i utvecklingsprojekt där den detaljerade kravbilden inte alltid är helt klar


Vi söker primärt en person med kunskaper inom Python. Nedan teknikområden är också önskvärda:

  • Programspråk så som P4, C, C++, Java, Java script
  • Linux, Yocto
  • Erfarenhet av att utveckla med Open Source-mjukvara
  • Software Defined Networking
  • Information Assurance och cybersäkerhet
  • Virtualisering
  • Förståelse för interaktion mellan mjukvara och hårdvara
  • Behörighet för elarbete är meriterande


Uppdraget utförs på plats i Saabs lokaler.

Befattningen kräver genomgång och godkännande enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan medföra krav på svenskt medborgarskap.

Vad du blir en del av

Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.

Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.

Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.

Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

Vänligen observera att urvalsarbetet i rekryteringsprocessen kommer att påbörjas i augusti månad, men vi tar gärna emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt!

Title: Software Engineer - Early Careers
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

About the Role: Important note: Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application. The team: Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for a web-based application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together, while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients. The impact: OSTTRA has the largest financial institutions in the world as clients, and our optimization businesses the largest banks in the world specifically. Our optimization services deliver significant impacts to clients portfolio compositions and operational costs, and when we run our services, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets move to a high degree. We believe that long-terms value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and technology is the tool to bring that value, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system. What’s in it for you: We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:


Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks
Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimised and supported for fast change
Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities
Innovative culture with strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements. We’ve worked with many students and hired several who joined originally during their studies - so this could be the place you activate your career. Early Career Software Engineer Position Profile We are seeking a newly graduated student to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimised and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities. Role Overview: As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects with a focus on talent, passion, and grit. While no prior work experience is required, we are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery
Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks
Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices What We're Looking For: Basic Qualifications:
Master's degree in Computer Science
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry. About OSTTRA Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts. OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group. With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement. Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets. Learn more at www.osttra.com. What’s In It For You? Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global. Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body. Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on. Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills. Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs. Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference. For more information on benefits by country visit: https://www.spglobal.com/en/careers/our-culture/ ----------------------------------------------------------- Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.  US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. ----------------------------------------------------------- 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group) Job ID: 299478 Posted On: 2024-03-21 Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Data Scientist - Game Economy
Description:
We are looking for a data scientist with a focus on game economy systems. You will play a critical role in designing, developing, and optimizing automated tools and simulations to enable and inform our team on economy designs & decisions.

You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, designers & other developers to provide the tooling needed to sustain a robust and growing in-game economy, which is a central part of the game.

Example Of Responsibilities


Build simulations that model various economic scenarios, allowing us to test and optimize in-game mechanics faster and more accurately.
Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to the in-game economy.
Provide insights and recommendations based on performance data to improve player experiences and revenue generation.
Enable designers by providing them with the necessary tools and data to balance in-game currencies, resources, and crafting mechanics.
Help ensure a balanced and engaging experience for our players.



We would love if you have


A creative and curious mind
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw actionable conclusions.
Experience building & running simulations of economies.
Proficiency in python or similar.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Passion for gaming and understanding of in-game economies is a plus.
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vill du jobba i ett företag med både hjärta och hjärna som satsar mycket på IT? Vill du forma innovativa och smarta IT- och AI-lösningar i agila team som skapar trygghet och värde för våra kunder? Just nu fokuserar vi på digitalisering av kundmötet, utveckling av morgondagens försäkringssystem och förflyttning mot publika molntjänster.




Datadomänen söker nu en Machine Learning Engineer till Skanstull i Stockholm som vill vara med på Folksams moln- och AI-resa.




Det här gör du som Machine Learning Engineer på Folksam

I rollen som ML Engineer inom Datadomänen spelar du en central roll i Folksams pågående moln- och AI-resa.




Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella agila team. Ditt arbete fokuserar på utveckling och implementering av AI -och maskininlärningslösningar. Du kommer att använda en rad olika verktyg och plattformar som exempelvis Azure Databricks, MLFlow, DevOps-pipelines för att hantera ML-applikationer från idé till produktionssättning. Arbetet innebär även nära samarbete med representanter från affärssidan för att undersöka och realisera olika initiativ inom AI/ML.




Nyfiken på att veta mer vad en Machine Learning Engineer jobbar med på Folksam? Gå in och läs här!




Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker en självgående individ med ett genuint intresse för maskininlärning. Du har antingen redan arbetat inom AI/ML, eller så är du ivrig att fördjupa dig och lära dig mer inom dessa spännande områden. Du älskar att lära dig nya saker och trivs i en miljö där du kan arbeta nära verksamheten. Vi är ett engagerat, tvärfunktionellt team som brinner för AI, och vi värdesätter kontinuerligt lärande och delat ansvar.




Vi ser att du som söker har:

En högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, maskininlärning, systemvetenskap, eller en liknande ingenjörsutbildning.
Kunskap inom AI och maskininlärning.
Goda programmeringskunskaper, gärna i Python.
Flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.




Följande är meriterande, men kan ersättas av nyfikenhet och viljan att lära dig:

Erfarenhet kring stora språkmodeller och vektordatabaser.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Microsoft Azure eller annan molnbaserad plattform.
Praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps och CI/CD.
Bekant med Openshift, Databricks och MLFlow.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med REST-API:er.

Du är naturligtvis nyfiken på ny teknik, älskar att lösa problem, är innovativ och tänker utanför givna ramar. Du är en lagspelare som gillar att samarbeta med andra och är alltid redo att testa nya saker.




Utvecklas tillsammans med oss

Folksam är ett kundägt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhetsfrågor. Vi har många roliga, utvecklande jobb och hos oss har du goda chanser till en spännande karriär med bra förmåner. Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Vi erbjuder flexibiliteten att varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån utifrån verksamhetens behov. Våra trevliga kontor runt om i landet ger mötesplatser för samarbete, lärande och en gemensam kultur – tillsammans skapar vi engagemang och kraft framåt! På folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar kan du läsa mer och se filmer om hur det är att jobba på Folksam.




Så söker du jobbet

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 18 augusti 2024. På grund av semesterperioden så kommer urvalsarbetet påbörjas vecka 34.




Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Jan Svanholt på 072-163 50 48. Alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonseringshjälp undanbedes.




Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson, 073-423 59 12 och Handels Mikael Karlsson 070-831 51 32.




Folksamgruppen erbjuder försäkringar och långsiktigt sparande som skapar trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi är cirka 4 000 medarbetare och vår vision är att våra kunder ska känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld. Vi engagerar oss i det våra kunder bryr sig om och är måna om att de är rätt försäkrade.
