Title: Data Science Specialist
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to work with customer data science teams, address end to end data science lifecycle and help them to see business value with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. As a data science specialist, you will focus on industry specific use cases, explain how to address business problems with cutting edge data science techniques, provide subject matter expertise and support while demonstrating the art of possible with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure using data science and machine learning techniques.

This role requires a strong ability to work with customer data science teams to solve complex problems and a collaborative mindset to drive success in a team-oriented environment. Deep technical expertise in advanced machine learning algorithms, a solid understanding of the data science lifecycle, and a proven track record of working on real data science problems are a must. The ideal candidate will have experience with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and possess a Master’s degree or higher. Collaboration will be a key characteristic of your work, both with customers and within Oracle, including with other Specialist teams and Product Management.

What You’ll Do:


Work closely with customer data science teams to understand their needs, provide insights, and help them solve specific business challenges.
Help customers design, develop, and implement advanced data science algorithms to solve complex data science and machine learning problems.
Analyze and interpret data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to key stakeholders across the organization.
Work closely with customers' cross-functional teams, including business users, data engineers, and data scientists, and address their requirements to deliver data-driven solutions.
Manage the entire data science lifecycle, from data collection and cleaning to model deployment and monitoring while working on customer problems or art-of-the-possible demo assets.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science, providing technical guidance and mentorship to team members.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in the data science world.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

What You’ll Bring:


Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in data science with a proven track record of leading successful data-driven projects.
Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and data analysis techniques.
Understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Proven experience working with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively
Experience working with customer data science teams to address and solve business problems.
Excellent teamwork and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, as well as experience with open-source tools and libraries like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.



A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen

Job Type: full-time

Help organizations worldwide realize the potential of AI with our signature AI Platform, GRACE.

Are you a highly ambitious and motivated Data Scientist interested in positively impacting the world with AI technology that you develop and deliver to clients worldwide? If so, you might be the new colleague we at 2021.AI are looking for!

2021.AI seeks a motivated Data Scientist to join our highly-skilled team of Data Scientists, working at the forefront of solving business challenges using statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. In this role, you will participate in data science projects and deliveries. In addition, you will assist in the future development of different AI / ML and technology services on our GRACE platform.

About You

You have high ambitions and want to positively impact the world with the AI / ML technology you develop and deliver to clients globally. This shines through in your ability to use statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering skills to deliver impactful and valuable business solutions across different industries in the private and public sectors.

You are independent, driven, motivated, and solution-oriented.

You work well with others. This entails teamwork with your internal team and with clients on- and off-site.

Your expertise is with data science, AI/ML, and related technologies, and you are passionate about delivering AI/ML solutions all the way from initial ML model research to implementing the working model in production.

You have experience in independently developing AI/ML, or statistical models or LLMs that solve particular business challenges, including the process of preparing the models for deployment and production.

You are interested in working with one of the best data science teams on the planet, technology rock stars, and business magnates, all dedicated to responsibly and positively impacting the future with AI.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at 2021.AI, you will make your mark and directly influence the direction of data science in 2021.AI while delivering value with AI and ML to our partners and clients.

You will participate as a Data Scientist in client projects and work closely with other teams in 2021.AI to improve our core product features, and demonstrate product value to clients on the GRACE Platform.

Key Responsibilities


Take part in projects developing AI and ML models for clients and partners
Embed those actions and insights into integrations and solutions for our clients’ businesses
Develop high-quality models with the business value behind in mind
Bring business objectives to the center of the ML development process


Skills And Qualifications


M.Sc. or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
2-3 years of hands-on, practical experience
Solid experience in Python programming combined with a mathematical/theoretical foundation in statistical modeling
Experience in writing production ready Python code
Data manipulation and visualization skills, including database handling and data cleaning/management
ML Engineering experience related to implementation and deployment of AI and ML into production via, e.g. Flask, FastAPI or Docker
Knowledge in LLMs including RAG construction and prompt engineering
Full working knowledge of English
Fast learning and a proactive mindset
Excellent presentation skills both toward business leaders and technical experts
Exceptional human and superb collaboration skills


Extra Consideration Is Given To Candidates With


The ability to identify potential use cases to create business value for our customers


About 2021.AI

Founded in Copenhagen with several offices worldwide, 2021.AI is a fast-growing AI company focused on closing the gap between AI ambitions and real AI value for companies worldwide. Large private and public organizations globally trust us to help them stay competitive, compliant, and in control when applying AI.

We are a team of passionate people who care deeply about the mission we are on; to positively impact the future with AI. Our tight-knit culture of camaraderie instills more than just a sense of belonging but great pride in our work. With high cultural ambitions, we expect you to bring lots of energy to the workplace and participate in company-related and social activities. In return, we promise great professional experiences and the freedom to tackle and own your tasks.

Supporting you professionally and personally


Professional Growth: Your CV will tell us where you've been, but we are also interested in where you want to go. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We trust our team members and give them autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development and provide regular feedback.
Meaningful Impact: In our company, every job matters, and you can see almost daily that you are making a meaningful impact. Our feedback loops are fast, which means you will have the opportunity to learn and advance quickly, growing together with the company.
Outstanding Team: Our AI platform GRACE helps companies and people cooperate across the board, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative, no-bureaucracy culture.
Excellent Benefits: We offer competitive pay, a healthcare benefits package, and a positive work-life balance.
For Copenhagen employees, we provide the corporate equipment you need, flexible working hours, team buildings, a fantastic office location in Nørrebro, Friday bars, coffee, laughs, and cutting-edge industry knowledge!


2021.AI is an equal opportunity company. We welcome all applicants no matter their race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, criminal prosecution, judgment in a criminal case, or any other characteristic protected by law.

For more information or questions please contact us at careers@2021.ai

Title: Fullstack Developer for AI/ML and Platform Engineering
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Ønskeskyen/GoWish:

At Ønskeskyen, with our international app platform GoWish, we've revolutionized the way users create, share, and fulfill wish lists for life's memorable moments, from weddings and birthdays to Christmas and everything in between. As a leader in digital gifting, we connect millions of users worldwide, providing a platform for thoughtful gifting and celebrating special occasions. Our technology-driven approach, focusing on user engagement and innovative solutions, makes us a pioneer in the gifting ecosystem.




Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Fullstack Developer with a strong focus on AI/ML solutions and platform engineering. In this role, you will work with data scientists to prototype and deploy solutions into production, while also focusing on platform scalability, big data management, and providing the best developer experience.




Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate closely with data scientists and machine learning engineers to understand AI/ML requirements and translate them into scalable, production-ready applications.
Develop full stack prototypes and production code for AI/ML solutions, including both front-end interfaces and back-end services.
Implement robust APIs and web services to serve AI/ML models at high QPS and throughput.
Ensure the seamless integration of AI/ML models into existing applications and systems, focusing on platform scalability and performance.
Optimize and monitor AI/ML model performance in production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to maintain high-quality code standards.
Provide expertise in big data technologies and tools to handle large-scale data processing for real time applications.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in full stack development technologies that relate to AI/ML.




Key Requirements:
Front-end Development: Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript.
Experience with modern front-end frameworks such as React.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles.
Back-end Development: Strong understanding of server-side programming languages such as Node.js, Python (Django, Flask), or Go.
Experience with building and consuming RESTful APIs and web services.
Knowledge of database systems (SQL and NoSQL) and experience with data modeling and management.
AI and Machine Learning:Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and familiarity with ML frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Ability to work with ML engineer, data scientists to implement and optimize AI/ML models.
Basic understanding on data processing libraries and tools (Pandas, NumPy, Apache Spark).
Deployment and Infrastructure:Proficient experience with cloud platforms (GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes or similar).
Expert in CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (Git).
Expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform.
GitOps practices and tooling.
Platform Engineering:Expertise in designing and maintaining scalable platforms to support AI/ML solutions.
Strong understanding of micro-services architecture and distributed systems.
Promote developer experience to generate high quality software and development workflow.
Ensure observability in data and AI solutions.




Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in the e-commerce or related industry.
Knowledge of A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.
Familiarity with big data technologies and distributed systems.




How You Can Help Data Scientists and ML Engineers:
Provide technical guidance and support in translating data science and AI prototypes into scalable production solutions.
Develop robust and scalable APIs and services to facilitate seamless integration of AI/ML models into the platform.
Optimize model performance and ensure reliable deployment in real-time and batch processing environments.
Collaborate on building automated data pipelines for efficient data processing and model training.
Implement observability tool stack to ensure the health and performance of deployed models.




Join Us:

If you are passionate about AI, machine learning, fullstack development, and platform engineering, and want to make a significant impact in the digital gifting space, we would love to hear from you. Join Ønskeskyen and help us shape the future of thoughtful gifting and celebration.




How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications, and any relevant portfolio or GitHub links.

Show more
HTML:
About Ønskeskyen/GoWish:

At Ønskeskyen, with our international app platform GoWish, we've revolutionized the way users create, share, and fulfill wish lists for life's memorable moments, from weddings and birthdays to Christmas and everything in between. As a leader in digital gifting, we connect millions of users worldwide, providing a platform for thoughtful gifting and celebrating special occasions. Our technology-driven approach, focusing on user engagement and innovative solutions, makes us a pioneer in the gifting ecosystem.


Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Fullstack Developer with a strong focus on AI/ML solutions and platform engineering. In this role, you will work with data scientists to prototype and deploy solutions into production, while also focusing on platform scalability, big data management, and providing the best developer experience.


Key Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate closely with data scientists and machine learning engineers to understand AI/ML requirements and translate them into scalable, production-ready applications.

  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles.
  • Back-end Development: Strong understanding of server-side programming languages such as Node.js, Python (Django, Flask), or Go.
  • Experience with building and consuming RESTful APIs and web services.
  • Knowledge of database systems (SQL and NoSQL) and experience with data modeling and management.
  • AI and Machine Learning:Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and familiarity with ML frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Ability to work with ML engineer, data scientists to implement and optimize AI/ML models.
  • Basic understanding on data processing libraries and tools (Pandas, NumPy, Apache Spark).
  • Deployment and Infrastructure:Proficient experience with cloud platforms (GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes or similar).
  • Expert in CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (Git).
  • Expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform.
  • GitOps practices and tooling.
  • Platform Engineering:Expertise in designing and maintaining scalable platforms to support AI/ML solutions.
  • Strong understanding of micro-services architecture and distributed systems.
  • Promote developer experience to generate high quality software and development workflow.
  • Ensure observability in data and AI solutions.


Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in the e-commerce or related industry.
  • Knowledge of A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.
  • Familiarity with big data technologies and distributed systems.


How You Can Help Data Scientists and ML Engineers:
  • Provide technical guidance and support in translating data science and AI prototypes into scalable production solutions.
  • Develop robust and scalable APIs and services to facilitate seamless integration of AI/ML models into the platform.
  • Optimize model performance and ensure reliable deployment in real-time and batch processing environments.
  • Collaborate on building automated data pipelines for efficient data processing and model training.
  • Implement observability tool stack to ensure the health and performance of deployed models.


Join Us:

If you are passionate about AI, machine learning, fullstack development, and platform engineering, and want to make a significant impact in the digital gifting space, we would love to hear from you. Join Ønskeskyen and help us shape the future of thoughtful gifting and celebration.


How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications, and any relevant portfolio or GitHub links.

Title: Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled data scientist with a strong background in machine learning and deep learning methods to drive the development our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.

This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately a better global usage of limited resources.




Primary tasks

Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for all steps of the data analysis. You will work in close collaboration with our software algorithm team, hardware team and marketing organization in taking the data analysis chain from concept to deployment and sales release.

Your responsibilities will be to:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets
Develop the algorithms and data pipelines
Design experiments to test the data analysis chain
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms




Your daily work will be at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød, Denmark




About you

You hold an M.Sc. or preferably a Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:




Expertise in using Python and libraries such as pandas and NumPy
Strong experience in training of machine learning models using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Knowledge on best practices for ML development
Understanding of image analysis and computer vision libraries such as OpenCV
Experience with development pipelines in cloud services such as Azure, AWS, or tools such as MLflow or are willing to learn
Understanding on how to optimize deep learning models for deployment on edge devices is a plus

We expect you to have an interest in:




The data analysis chain of analytical instrument
Exploration of data in problem solving
Developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain




As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You are curious on new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.




We offer

We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D and work closely together with universities. FOSS is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strive at delivering cutting-edge creative and robust algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal tone.




Application

Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, so apply now - better today than tomorrow! Any questions can be directed to Senior Scientist Erik Schou Dreier (+45 4063 8708 or esd@foss.dk) or Director Lars Nørgaard (+45 2761 6958 or lno@foss.dk).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.




FOSS

Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects it has on climate change.

FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40,000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety, and securing fair payment.

Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1,700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.

Apply for job as Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision in R&D

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This role offers a diverse and challenging role, tackling various tasks for different companies using multiple technologies. You will build data pipelines and deploy machine learning solutions, collaborating closely with data scientists and solution managers.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain APIs
Manage cloud setups and DevOps
Analyze customer IT systems for ML solution integration
Create ML pipelines to integrate ML services into IT systems

Required Qualifications

Experience deploying machine learning models
Proficiency in Python
Professional proficiency in Danish

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with various database types (relational, graph, NoSQL, document)
Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure)
Background in software development or data engineering

Personal Attributes

Strong communication skills with customers and stakeholders
Independent and quick to learn new technologies and solve problems
Business-oriented with an interest in the interaction between software and business value
Team player who values cooperation and knowledge sharing

Please send over your CV and this will be reviewed immediately


Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Lead Data & AI Scientist
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by productionizing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions?




Join our Advanced Analytics & AI team to help improve and grow our data science portfolio – and become one of the leading minds behind ECCO’s future setup for advanced analytics. Making your mark on data science at ECCO, you will help empower business units to make data-driven decisions and even automate operations.




Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead the data science initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how ECCO operates based on data. This means working with the entire value chain – from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing and store operations.




As a Lead Data Scientist, you will develop, implement and deliver complex solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. Using DevOps and DataOps pipelines, you will deploy and maintain solutions, and you will:




Be a leading mind in the Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely together with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Scope and develop new data science products, e.g. for price optimisation, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare and synthesise data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised and re-enforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform that is delivered by the Data Platform team




You enjoy applying analytics to real-life business challenges

While self-driven and resourceful, you enjoy working in teams to solve challenges and develop the best solutions. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimisation and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.




You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working – and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:




Hold a master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. statistics, mathematics, engineering or operation research
Have significant experience as a Senior Data Scientist or an equivalent quantitative role with a strong focus on statistics
Have significant experience using data science/database software and programming languages, such as SQL, R and Python
Have experience with unified analytics engines such as Apache Spark and Databricks, as well as with container platform/orchestration systems such as Docker/Kubernetes
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus.




We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with 30+ highly skilled, motivated, collaborative and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.




We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this development.




Are you ready for your next challenge?

We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply. Due to the summer holidays, the application deadline for this position is August 2nd, 2024. We plan to have the first calls with candidates in the second half of August.




For additional information, you can reach out to Head of Advanced Analytics & AI, Thomas Jauho THJAU@ecco.com.




Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on https://enter.ecco.com.




CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.




Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.




Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.

Title: Data Scientist med IT flair
Description:
YouSee søger en dygtig Data Scientist til vores team Digital Excellence i Aarhus under afdelingen Digital Service. Afdelingens mål er at digitalisere kunderejsen på tværs af vores kanaler og sikre den gode kundeoplevelse. I vores afdeling er vi ikke underlagt at arbejde med bestemte værktøjer. Tværtimod tager vi selv ansvaret for at benytte de løsninger og redskaber, vi vurderer bedst til at løse de problemstillinger, vi bliver mødt med.

Din rolle og dine opgaver:

Din primære opgave vil være at anvende ML til at forbedre interne og eksterne processer. Du vil arbejde med de nyeste ML-felter, som f.eks. LLM/RAG, hvor du løbende tilegner dig ny viden og sætter ML i en forretningsmæssig kontekst, der skaber værdi.

Din rolle vil være at medvirke til øget kvalitet og struktur i alle de essentielle dele af et ML/ETL setup, herunder:


Optimering af chatbot RAG (udvikles i Cognigy Omnichannel Agent Platform).
Sikre integration mellem systemer i forbindelse med ML projekter.
Udvikle og integrere kreative og skalérbare ML løsninger ud fra eksisterende teknologier.
Navigere i et bredt landskab af IT-løsninger, som du selv er med til definere.
Præsentation af resultater og anbefalinger.



I dine opgaver kan du se frem til både at arbejde på tværs af afdelinger og på tværs af digitale og analoge kanaler. Du vil med tiden få ansvaret for både små og store data- og analyseprojekter. Disse projekter skal bære præg af en forståelse for forretningen, så der sikres værdi.

Din person:

Som Data Scientist vil du ofte blive mødt af en konkret forretningsproblematik. Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:


Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
Visionær med åbent sind.
Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.



Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:


Udvikling i Python
Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
Backend-udvikling
IT-principper/økosystemer
REST API



Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2024.

Kontaktperson: Director Lars Ørnholt Kier, mobil: 21642185 (i ugerne 28-30 kontaktes Data Scientist Kristian Kristensen, mobil 42451206)

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere


Show more
HTML:
YouSee søger en dygtig Data Scientist til vores team Digital Excellence i Aarhus under afdelingen Digital Service. Afdelingens mål er at digitalisere kunderejsen på tværs af vores kanaler og sikre den gode kundeoplevelse. I vores afdeling er vi ikke underlagt at arbejde med bestemte værktøjer. Tværtimod tager vi selv ansvaret for at benytte de løsninger og redskaber, vi vurderer bedst til at løse de problemstillinger, vi bliver mødt med.

Din rolle og dine opgaver:

Din primære opgave vil være at anvende ML til at forbedre interne og eksterne processer. Du vil arbejde med de nyeste ML-felter, som f.eks. LLM/RAG, hvor du løbende tilegner dig ny viden og sætter ML i en forretningsmæssig kontekst, der skaber værdi.

Din rolle vil være at medvirke til øget kvalitet og struktur i alle de essentielle dele af et ML/ETL setup, herunder:

  • Optimering af chatbot RAG (udvikles i Cognigy Omnichannel Agent Platform).
  • Sikre integration mellem systemer i forbindelse med ML projekter.
  • Udvikle og integrere kreative og skalérbare ML løsninger ud fra eksisterende teknologier.
  • Navigere i et bredt landskab af IT-løsninger, som du selv er med til definere.
  • Præsentation af resultater og anbefalinger.


I dine opgaver kan du se frem til både at arbejde på tværs af afdelinger og på tværs af digitale og analoge kanaler. Du vil med tiden få ansvaret for både små og store data- og analyseprojekter. Disse projekter skal bære præg af en forståelse for forretningen, så der sikres værdi.

Din person:

Som Data Scientist vil du ofte blive mødt af en konkret forretningsproblematik. Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:

  • Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
  • Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
  • Visionær med åbent sind.
  • Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
  • Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.


Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:

  • Udvikling i Python
  • Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
  • Backend-udvikling
  • IT-principper/økosystemer
  • REST API


Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2024.

Kontaktperson: Director Lars Ørnholt Kier, mobil: 21642185 (i ugerne 28-30 kontaktes Data Scientist Kristian Kristensen, mobil 42451206)

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere

Title: AI Application Engineer
Description:
Join our pioneering team at BESTSELLER as we embrace the power of data science and AI to redefine the retail and e-commerce landscape. We seek an experienced AI Application Engineer passionate about harnessing data for innovation. This role places you at the forefront of our APPRETIO platform, our dedication to revolutionizing merchandising through data-driven solutions.

YOUR NEW ROLE

As a key player in the APPRETIO team, you'll lead the development of interactive AI solutions, the backbone of our data-driven decision-making. Collaborating with top-tier data scientists, engineers, and analysts, you'll work closely with various business stakeholders. Your challenge? To revolutionize our data usage and redefine our business strategy and operations.

YOUR TEAM

You will join the dynamic Data & Analytics department, a vibrant community of over 50 professionals passionate about driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. Embedded in a product team of ten top-tier professionals, you will leverage data to enhance customer experiences, optimize operations, and drive revenue growth - all while upholding the highest standards of customer satisfaction and quality.

YOUR IMPACT

In your capacity as an AI Application Engineer, you will:


Design and execute machine learning services within a top AI delivery team.
Engage in application development and data science experimentation to maximize consumer value, satisfaction, and quality.
Utilize the latest tools such as Python, Pytorch, Kubernetes, Plotly Dash, Databricks, MLFlow, and Snowflake to build and sustain robust applications.
Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences and successful feature implementation.
Monitor, debug, and optimize machine learning models and applications to enhance performance, scalability, and reliability.


Your Benefits

This role offers a dynamic and challenging environment where quick, impactful decisions are the norm. You will:


Join a diverse and expert team in a supportive, inclusive, and dynamic work environment that values collaboration and innovation.
Advance your career with extensive professional growth opportunities, including leadership development, specialized training programs, and international project exposure.
Access dedicated training, educational programs, and a pathway to various certifications.


YOUR PROFILE

You are an energetic, proactive team player, motivated by utilizing data and turning it into intelligent applications. You can recognize yourself in most of the following statements:


PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related fields.
Advanced Python proficiency and a robust interest in machine learning and predictive modeling.
Solid understanding of the statistical and algorithmic foundations of machine learning.
Proven experience deploying AI applications in production settings.
Excellent communication skills, delivering effective technical presentations to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in agile environments and a proactive, solution-focused approach to tasks.
English fluency, both spoken and written.


The following qualifications would also be an advantage:


Proficiency in Plotly Dash, cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure), and database management systems (SQL, NoSQL).
Experience with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, and developing/maintaining production-grade web applications.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.


WORK LOCATION

Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

To make sure you're in the running, please send your application and CV by July 12th. We review candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the job ad when we have found the right candidate. For inquiries about the position, please contact Emil Hartvig Pedersen at +45 29628203. We can't wait to hear from you!

About Bestseller

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 20,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We have recently embarked on a transformative journey in the realm of advanced analytics, venturing into untapped territories across consumer engagement, supply chain, merchandising, and manufacturing domains. Our focus is on cultivating in-house expertise in areas such as personalization & recommendation, forecasting models, and trend analysis, aiming to elevate our innovation and customer satisfaction to unprecedented heights.

As an MLOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the infrastructure and platform essential for scaling our machine learning systems efficiently from experimentation to production. Your contribution will be pivotal in enabling and automating data-driven decision-making processes, utilizing cutting-edge techniques and ensuring the seamless integration of machine learning models into our operational workflows.

Top of Form

Bottom of Form

Responsibilities


Design, implement and maintain the ML platform and infrastructure required for ML systems to scale
Facilitate an efficient ML route to live from experiment to production.
Develop and deploy scalable tools and services to handle machine learning training and inference
Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of ML systems
Apply software engineering rigor and best practices to machine learning, including CI/CD, automation, etc.
Support model development, with an emphasis on auditability, versioning, and data security
Communicate with product team and data scientists and machine learning engineers to build requirements and track progress



Qualifications


Experience building end-to-end systems as a Platform Engineer, DevOps Engineer
Strong software engineering skills in complex, multi-language systems
Fluency in Python
Experience working with Infrastructure as Code, e.g. Terraform
Experience working with cloud computing and database systems (SQL, no-SQL, distributed systems, data lakes, etc) such as Databricks
Experience building custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs
Experience developing with containerisation (e.g Docker) and orchestration Kubernetes in cloud computing environments
Familiarity with one or more data-oriented workflow orchestration frameworks (KubeFlow, Airflow, Argo, etc.)
Ability to translate business needs to technical requirements
Strong understanding of software testing, benchmarking, and continuous integration
Experience in infrastructure, data and model monitoring & alerting (e.g. tools like NewRelic, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack)
Exposure and understanding of FinOps best practices for the public cloud
Exposure to machine learning methodology and best practices



Preferred but not must have:


Exposure to deep learning approaches and modeling frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, etc.)



Education & Experience


2–5 years experience building production-quality software.
Bachelors or Masters degree and/or equivalent professional experience



Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

we deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office  @jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Turbine/Blade Data Scientist
Description:
With the ongoing green transition and the dynamic growth of the wind energy sector, we are embarking on an exciting and challenging journey. Join us as we are currently seeking a candidate with experience in the wind industry to strengthen our digital R&D team.




About this position

As our new Turbine/Blade Data Scientist, you will join our R&D team, which includes software developers, data analysts, fiber optic experts, and hardware developers. You will work closely with specialists in electronics, optics, and sensor technology in the Sensors and Embedded Software and Digital & Cloud Solutions departments. This collaboration aims to deliver innovative sensing solutions that enhance the efficiency of wind turbines worldwide.

We are looking for someone with a background in the wind industry who can bring their ideas and solutions to both new and existing standard solutions.




Your main tasks and responsibilities

As a Turbine/Blade Data Scientist, you will develop concepts and algorithms with inputs from customers and internal specialists for all our sensing products and solutions. By developing systems that feed real-time data to the wind turbine controllers, your contributions will directly help make wind energy more efficient and affordable.




Furthermore, you will:

Continuously improving our codebase and testing infrastructure.
Implement production ready concepts and technical solutions addressing market challenges.
Improve and simplify existing blade monitoring and optimization solutions. This includes autonomous bending moment calibration and autonomous ice detection.
Regularly evaluate new possible concepts and algorithms.




Your qualifications and skills

Have a Physics degree, Wind Energy Master, or similar educations.
Have strong Python programming skills.
Experience with load and control within wind energy.
Be able to transform blade dynamics into software algorithms.




Furthermore, it is an advantage if you have:

Worked with measurement data.
Speak English fluently, since you will be part of a global organization.




Your personality

You are a structured person with a focus on configurable, efficient, and maintainable solutions.

You thrive in a team with a wide range of skills and in a global, collaborative environment filled with curiosity, ideas, and suggestions.




Apply for this job

Polytech offers this position in a dynamic company working toward the green transition in collaboration with the major players in the wind industry. We can offer you a collaborative and supportive environment with great colleagues, and opportunities for personal and professional development.




You will be based at our Herning office.




For further information about this position, you are welcome to contact Senior Manager, Embedded Software Jeppe Frandsen, jfr@polytech.com or +45 41 99 85 14.




To apply for this position, please submit your application through our applications portal. Applications are welcome both in English and Danish. Please note that applications via e-mails are not accepted due to GDPR. We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will take down the job ad once the right candidate is identified.




Polytech is an equal opportunity employer and promotes a diverse workforce. We therefore encourage everyone with the right skills to apply for our open positions.




About Polytech

At Polytech, we improve the durability and performance of wind turbines. Founded in 1994 we are now front-runners in developing holistic solutions for OEMs, owners, and developers in the wind industry within areas of lightning protection, leading edge protection, blade monitoring and optimization, transport, and subsea.

Title: Machine Learning developer with DSP experience
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


Requirements

The ideal candidate


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Machine learning and neural networks
Digital Signal processing (DSP)


Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Software development experience
Strong communication skills


Responsibilities


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:


Highly skilled colleagues
Career growth inside trackman
International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
Social activities


Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarter located in Denmark (Vedbæk) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 650 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured. We will this summer move from Vedbæk to DTU Science Park in Hørsholm to our state-of-the-art 12.400 m2 new Headquarter.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including your diploma as soon as possible and join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is either at HQ in Vedbæk (soon Hørsholm) or a smaller office in Aarhus (Incuba). Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen

Job Type: full-time

Help organizations worldwide realize the potential of AI with our signature AI Platform, GRACE.

Are you a highly ambitious and motivated Senior Data Scientist interested in positively impacting the world with AI technology that you develop and deliver to clients worldwide? If so, you might be the new colleague 2021.AI is looking for!

2021.AI seeks an experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our highly-skilled team of Data Scientists, working at the forefront of solving business challenges using statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. In this role, you will participate in and lead data science projects and deliveries. In addition, you will assist in the future development of different AI / ML and technology services on our GRACE platform.

About You

You have high ambitions and want to positively impact the world with the AI / ML technology you develop and deliver to clients globally. This shines through in your ability to use statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. to deliver impactful and valuable business solutions across different industries in the private and public sectors.

You are independent, driven, motivated, and solutions-oriented.

You work well with others. This entails teamwork with your internal team and with clients on- and off-site.

Your expertise is with data science, AI/ML, and related technologies such as LLMs, and you are passionate about delivering AI/ML solutions all the way from initial ML model research to implementing the working model in production.

You have experience in independently developing AI/ML or statistical models including LLMs that solve particular business challenges, including the process of preparing the models for deployment and production.

You are interested in working with one of the best data science teams on the planet, technology rock stars, and business magnates, all dedicated to responsibly and positively impacting the future with AI and other emerging technologies.

About The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist at 2021.AI, you will make your mark and directly influence the direction of data science in 2021.AI while delivering value with AI and ML to our partners and clients.

You will scope, run, and participate as a data science expert in client projects, work closely with senior business professionals and other teams in 2021.AI to improve our core product features, and demonstrate product value to clients on the GRACE Platform. You are responsible for reviewing and securing the quality of the projects before delivery to our clients.

Key Responsibilities


Participate and run projects developing AI and ML models for clients and partners
Share knowledge and develop best practices within Data Science
Embed those actions and insights into integrations and solutions for our client's businesses
Ensure high model quality before delivery
Bring business objectives to the center of the ML development process


Skills And Qualifications


M.Sc., Ph.D., or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
5+ years of hands-on, practical/industry project experience
Solid experience Python programming combined with a mathematical/theoretical foundation in statistical modeling
Experience in writing production ready Python code including tests and automation
Knowledge of statistical concepts related to machine learning model selection and evaluation, including elements such as bias measurement and mitigation, model ensembling, and cost-sensitive modeling
Data manipulation and visualization skills, including database handling and data cleaning/management
ML Engineering experience related to implementation and deployment of AI and ML into production via, e.g. Flask, FastAPI or Docker and the automation of training cycles etc.
Knowledge in LLMs including finetuning, RAG construction and prompt engineering
Experience in project execution and delivery to businesspeople
Full working knowledge of English
Fast learning and a proactive mindset
Excellent presentation skills both toward business leaders and technical experts
Exceptional human and collaboration skills


Extra Consideration Is Given To Candidates With


The ability to identify potential use cases to create business value for our customers


About 2021.AI

Founded in Copenhagen with several offices worldwide, 2021.AI is a fast-growing AI company focused on closing the gap between AI ambitions and real AI value for companies worldwide. Large private and public organizations globally trust us to help them stay competitive, compliant, and in control when applying AI.

We are a team of passionate people who care deeply about the mission we are on; to positively impact the future with AI. Our tight-knit culture of camaraderie instills more than just a sense of belonging but great pride in our work. With high cultural ambitions, we expect you to bring lots of energy to the workplace and participate in company-related and social activities. In return, we promise great professional experiences and the freedom to tackle and own your tasks.

Supporting you professionally and personally


Professional Growth: Your CV will tell us where you've been, but we are also interested in where you want to go. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We trust our team members and give them autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development and provide regular feedback.
Meaningful Impact: In our company, every job matters, and you can see almost daily that you are making a meaningful impact. Our feedback loops are fast, which means you will have the opportunity to learn and advance quickly, growing together with the company.
Outstanding Team: Our AI platform GRACE helps companies and people cooperate across the board, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative, no-bureaucracy culture.
Excellent Benefits: We offer competitive pay, a healthcare benefits package, and a positive work-life balance.
For Copenhagen-based employees, we provide the corporate equipment you need, flexible working hours, team buildings, a fantastic office location in Nørrebro, Friday bars, coffee, laughs, and cutting-edge industry knowledge!


2021.AI is an equal opportunity company. We welcome all applicants no matter their race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, criminal prosecution, judgment in a criminal case, or any other characteristic protected by law.

For more information or questions please contact us at careers@2021.ai

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Gdansk or Viby
Description:
Location

Gdansk, PL Viby J, DK

Are you ready to drive data-driven insights to support Corporate Finance and Legal as part as our Digital Finance Solutions ART. Would you like to join a group of committed and responsible colleagues working hybrid between Poland and Denmark? Then join us in creating the future of dairy!

We are looking for a skilled Senior Data Scientist to our hybrid team supporting the data focused journey in our Corporate Finance and Legal area of Arla. The team you will join, is a cross functional team. We have Data Engineers and PowerBI developers, working closely with other areas of Advanced Analytics in Arla IT Solutions.

About The Job

In the role as Senior Data Scientist you will bring insights and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise data analyses, visualizations, reports, and presentations in the Finance and Legal area. Moreover, you will be


Analyzing financial, legal and HR data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for development towards Arla’s strategic goals together with Finance, Legal and HR stakeholders.
Developing and implementing models to analyze historical financial and HR data and create predictive models for usage to optimize our financial and HR processes
Developing and delivering analysis and models to support Extended Producer Responsibility Tax schemes, Fraud Transaction Scanning models, compliant usage of sensitive HR data etc.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams across IT solutions and different areas of Arla, working on delivering features as part of Digital Finance Solutions Agile Release Train in a fully agile team.
Collaborating with external vendors to deliver on projects.


Who are you?


You hold a Bachelor or Master's Degree in Data Science, IT, Finance or other related field.
You have strong experience in statistics, data analytics, and data science, preferably within Finance, HR and/or the Legal domain.
You understand working with Azure data lake.
Your proficiency in programming languages enables you to manipulate, analyse, and model data effectively.
You also have a good knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modelling techniques. Moreover, you are experienced in using data visualization tools to communicate insights and findings in a clear and impactful manner.
With your strong analytical mindset, you are capable of structuring and interpreting complex datasets. This skill is especially valuable in your role, where you are expected to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Your excellent communication and organizational skills facilitate effective interaction with various stakeholders.
Given your experience, you are well-equipped to thrive in a fast-paced environment, consistently meeting deadlines.
Finally, your fluency in English is essential for effective communication in your role.


What do we offer?

At Arla, we value our IT specialists and provide a range of attractive benefits to support your personal and professional growth


Trainings with industry experts and a comprehensive induction program,
Financial support for ongoing education and professional development,
Flexibility in working hours and the option to work from home,
Medical care and life insurance coverage,
Employee Assistance Program offering legal, psychological, health, and financial consulting,
Additional perks like gym memberships, vouchers, travel points, and cinema tickets,
Home kit including a monitor, laptop, keyboard, mouse, headsets, and webcam,
Relaxation breaks to recharge and maintain work-life balance,
Relocation allowance for a smooth transition to our vibrant city,
Referral program for employees to earn rewards by recommending top talent (applicable in Poland),
Additional holiday days based on length of employment (up to 4 days).


Application and contact

If you want to be part of our journey and help improve our Finance, Legal and HR data journey, then seize this exciting opportunity.

We look forward to receiving your application and CV as soon as possible. We will be conducting interviews ongoing.

We have a purpose for Good

At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?

BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link.

Title: Growth Engineer - Ruby on Rails
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join the Tonsser Team as a Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)

Who We Are

Tonsser, the leading app and platform for youth football, is revolutionizing the football industry. With nearly 2 million football players in 11 countries, we're not just about discovering new talent; we're about building a community that celebrates the joy of football. Our mission? To democratize football by providing equal access to opportunities , empowering players to showcase their skills and connect with global clubs.

Your Role

As a Growth Engineer at Tonsser, you'll be a vital part of our growth team , directly impacting and unlocking our fast-growing football platform. The growth team is a special part of the company focussed on analysing, developing, testing, validating and experimenting with smaller fast paced growth projects.

Your work will directly and quickly impact our goals, and you will be working on a number of different projects, prototyping, validating and refining the ideas from your team. While also contributing to longer term projects contributing to Tonsser's online presence and user acquisition.

Key Responsibilities


Develop, and rigorously test hypotheses to uncover new growth levers that can be scaled.
Dive deep into user behavior analytics to pinpoint growth opportunities
Conduct A/B testing and other experimental initiatives.
Foster cross-functional collaboration to achieve key business objectives effectively


Qualifications


Strong in Ruby on Rails and partly some frontend and SQL
Strong analytical skills and comfort with data-driven decision-making
Innovative and creative thinker with a hypothesis-driven approach to problem-solving
Comfortable with Analytics tools and Excel.
Ability to analyze user data
Strong attention to detail and ability to balance multiple projects and deadlines
Thrives in a fast-paced environment
Curious by nature and a fast learner


What We Expect

We are looking for someone who is versatile, able to prototype , ideate , build and understand the underlying data, or even ensuring the data exists in the first place.

You should be a team player, ready to share ideas and respect diverse opinions. Your problem-solving skills should lead you to find the best solution for the moment. Your experience is broad, and covers Python, Ruby on Rails, Data scraping manipulation, maybe even some SEO. Keywords being broad , versatile and having a curious mindset .

Our Engineering Culture

As part of Tonsser’s growth team, you'll join a group of passionate product enthusiasts . We are creative product builders who love to craft high-quality software using the best tools of the trade. Our environment is one that encourages innovation , creativity, and growth .

Position Details

Role: Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)

Salary range: €50K - €68K yearly

Start date: September 2024

€50,000 - €68,000 a year

About Tonsser

Offices in Paris, Berlin and HQ in Copenhagen

Backed by international investors, top level football players and founders of companies like Spotify, Booking.com, Peakon, Vivino ...

Being part of Tonsser means you're working on something very exciting: Shaping the future of football. Through technology we've seen a way to impact how new talents can be empowered and discovered; we're changing the game of football by placing the power where it belongs: in the hands of the 265 million performers of the sport. For the football players to be in control, they need their own football identity.

That's why we've built an app empowering football players to showcase their achievements and determine their success.

Curious to know more about us?


Tonsser on LinkedIn
BBC: 'Meet the Underdog national team'
Uncovering hidden football talent through social scouting app
How a football app used data to challenge the best academies in Europe (Tonsser Medium blog)
Huddersfield Town: Could e-scouting help Premier League side? (BBC)
Tonsser, the social app for youth soccer players, collaborates with Nike and raises new funding (TechCrunch)
Don't just take our word for it, check out our Glassdoor reviews
Tonsser represents Denmark in the Nordic showcase as 'The next generation of superstars'


Download the app for iOS or Android .
