HTML:
Join the Tonsser Team as a Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)

Who We Are

Tonsser, the leading app and platform for youth football, is revolutionizing the football industry. With nearly 2 million football players in 11 countries, we're not just about discovering new talent; we're about building a community that celebrates the joy of football. Our mission? To democratize football by providing equal access to opportunities , empowering players to showcase their skills and connect with global clubs.

Your Role

As a Growth Engineer at Tonsser, you'll be a vital part of our growth team , directly impacting and unlocking our fast-growing football platform. The growth team is a special part of the company focussed on analysing, developing, testing, validating and experimenting with smaller fast paced growth projects.

Your work will directly and quickly impact our goals, and you will be working on a number of different projects, prototyping, validating and refining the ideas from your team. While also contributing to longer term projects contributing to Tonsser's online presence and user acquisition.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, and rigorously test hypotheses to uncover new growth levers that can be scaled.
  • Dive deep into user behavior analytics to pinpoint growth opportunities
  • Conduct A/B testing and other experimental initiatives.
  • Foster cross-functional collaboration to achieve key business objectives effectively

Qualifications

  • Strong in Ruby on Rails and partly some frontend and SQL
  • Strong analytical skills and comfort with data-driven decision-making
  • Innovative and creative thinker with a hypothesis-driven approach to problem-solving
  • Comfortable with Analytics tools and Excel.
  • Ability to analyze user data
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to balance multiple projects and deadlines
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • Curious by nature and a fast learner

What We Expect

We are looking for someone who is versatile, able to prototype , ideate , build and understand the underlying data, or even ensuring the data exists in the first place.

You should be a team player, ready to share ideas and respect diverse opinions. Your problem-solving skills should lead you to find the best solution for the moment. Your experience is broad, and covers Python, Ruby on Rails, Data scraping manipulation, maybe even some SEO. Keywords being broad , versatile and having a curious mindset .

Our Engineering Culture

As part of Tonsser’s growth team, you'll join a group of passionate product enthusiasts . We are creative product builders who love to craft high-quality software using the best tools of the trade. Our environment is one that encourages innovation , creativity, and growth .

Position Details

Role: Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)

Salary range: €50K - €68K yearly

Start date: September 2024

€50,000 - €68,000 a year

Offices in Paris, Berlin and HQ in Copenhagen

Title: Solutions Engineer - Denmark
Description:
Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 40% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

Summary

As an Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional Solutions Engineering Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

What You’ll Do


Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards, product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meet-ups, and industry events.


What You’ll Bring


Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
Mastered the technical sales process
Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
Ability to travel up to 50%
Cloud security experience
AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
Network engineering experience
Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys


BONUS POINTS:


Experience with traditional CSPM tools
SaaS experience
Awareness of the CI/CD process
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code


If your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Smørumnedre, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
DeltaPix has great ambitions for the Microscopes and imaging solutions of the future and needs your creative brain and skills to accomplish them.




Your role

With your experience and structured approach, you will design, develop, and maintain software and optical solutions used worldwide by industry and universities. With your skilled team members located in Smørum, you will participate actively in all phases of product development.

A normal day will consist of the daily start-up meeting with your colleagues, where the current progress and potential barriers are discussed with your team members.

Then you will work on creating the best possible optical solutions by combining optics, mechanics, electronics, and software. This involves writing new code, optimizing existing code, or maybe fixing a critical bug.




You will work with

·        .NET C# user interface and algorithmsapplication development.

·        C++ algorithmsAlgorithm development.

·        PC and embedded systems development (Arduino).

·        Optical components and accomplishing mechanicsIntegration of hardware components.

·           Basic electronics.

·        Agile development methods.

·        Test and bug fixing.

 

We expect you to have some experience with most of the above areas.

You will also have some occasional customer contact, so reasonable patience and empathy are an advantage.




The future

We are constantly striving to develop better microscope and imaging solutions, and we are currently planning a major redesign of our software platform ‘DeltaPix InSight’.

Concurrently we are an active partner in an ambitious European Union technology project, which is going on until end 2026. This involves collaboration with major European companies and universities: https://www.optimal-project.eu/ . DeltaPix is also involved in the project “UVSOLAR”, funded by “Innovation fund Denmark” https://innovationsfonden.dk/da/press-release/nyt-forskningsprojekt-vil-revolutionere .

DeltaPix is an active participant in the startup of both projects, and the new employee will be involved in both projects, depending on skills and interest.




Our culture and what we offer

Our employees are our main resource, and their well-being and engagement are a top priority. Daily work is done in an unformal, humoristic, and friendly environment.

’Discover the Details’ is our fundamental promise to our customers and is also our motivation when we create innovative solutions.

We have a very open and flexible work environment and offer equipment to enable employees to work from home.




We offer a competitive salary package, which includes pension and healthcare, and optional share options. You

will be a key employee in DeltaPix and there are really no limits to what you can achieve, including a potential co-ownership, if you have the ambitions.




Join DeltaPix

DeltaPix is pioneering the digital microscopy industry and has done so for more than 20 years, introducing many innovative technologies and solutions to meet different market requirements.

The first innovative product to be released by DeltaPix back in 2003, was the groundbreaking Infinity X, with 21 million real color pixels, setting new standards for microscopy cameras at that time. 

DeltaPix develops and markets a wide range of digital imaging solutions for various industrial, forensics, and biomedical microscopy applications, and has established very deep and broad expertise in digital image capturing, image handling, and processing.

 

DeltaPix’s mission statement:

The DeltaPix mission is to make the latest advances in digital microscope technology, available and easy to use for a wider range of users in both commercial and non-commercial organizations, also those with limited resources and education. Empowering a larger range of engineers, researchers, start-ups, and other professionals to discover the valuable details of the microscopic world will support the development of new materials, medicines, and environmentally sustainable products.







The mission is based on innovative, top-motivated, and highly skilled employees, and we focus on creating a meaningful and developing work environment.




We are committed to market-leading support, compliance with legislation, and fair treatment of subcontractors, customers, and other stakeholders of the company.




Our mission is carried out with attention to the environment and climate, and DeltaPix intends to be carbon negative. Our initiatives and the date for achieving this will be announced on our homepage on a regular basis.

The intention with the formulation of our mission is that it should permeate all decisions in the organization and in the daily priorities and decisions of the employees.




The mission is the core of our business and flows in our veins.

 




Apply ASAP

Please send your application including a CV as soon as possible to Randi.skindbjerg@deltapix.dk.

We do interviews on an ongoing basis until we have found the right colleague.




If you would like to know more about the role, please do not hesitate to contact us.










Show more

Title: Backend Engineer Intern at an AI Language Startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Languee is an AI app for learning industry-specific terms in real-life scenarios. We also provide a staff management platform for employees allocation based on their language skills.

We are on a mission to enable professionals to propel their career qualifications. Additionally, we empower businesses to expand globally and exchange knowledge across international departments. Our startup strives to create a global economy and allow collaboration across borders.

Join our mission as an intern with future possibility. Gain valuable experience AND drive a great change.

Responsibilities


Develop and improve backend of a mobile application.
Optimise API calls speed.
Integrate AI voicebot functionality using OpenAI APIs.


Requirements


Experience with Python and Flask.
Experience with API integration (especially OpenAI API).
(Nice-to-have) Familiarity with GitHub.


Ideal Candidate


Adaptable to fast-paced environment. Comfortable with learning on the go.
Able to work within multiple projects at once.
Proactive and self-motivated.
Tech-savvy and interested in newest technologies.
Eager to learn and dive deep into new areas.


Why Join Our Startup?


Real-world experience.
Mentorship and guidance.
Diverse responsibilities and getting hands dirty within different departments.
Networking with entrepreneurs and other software developers.
Potential for future opportunities as a paid employee or a freelancer.
Flexibility in terms of working hours.


For more information or questions please contact us at igors@languee.dk

Title: Full stack Developer 6 to 12 Months Contract
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced self going skilled developer to develop a web based portal with several integrations and different authentication methods used.

Project Description:


We are introducing multifactor authentication to the client's workstations to improve endpoint device security and enhance the sign-in process for employees and consultants
The solution will be available on the Internet so you can access it from anywhere. Strong authentication solutions are being used to ensure the identity of the person logging into the portal before allowing access to functions like password resets and initiation of the enrolment



Required Skills:


Experience with development of REST API's using Java Spring Boot microservices
Experience with Angular/NodeJS/JavaScript/HTML/CSS skills for the frontend part
Experience of integrating strong authentication methods in a UI
Use to a developer role in a large organization having DevOps team
Experience in Powershell and WebView
Experience in Developer tools IntelliJ/Eclipse, VSCode, Git



Beneficial Experience:


Preferable hands-on experience with the client's System Engineering Platform (Kubernetes)
Preferible Kubernetes experience
Experience with Linux server operational
Skills for parametr use and integration of National ID's like MitID, BankID, FTN
Knowledge of the SAFe framework
LDAP configuration



Start date: ASAP

End date: 31/12/2024

Location: Taastrup, Denmark

Requirements

Required skills


REST API's
Powershell and WebView
integrating strong authentication methods in a UI
DevOps Team
Angular/NodeJS/JavaScript/HTML/CSS
Developer tools IntelliJ/Eclipse, VSCode, Git
Java Spring Boot microservices



Preferred Skills


Linux server operational
Kubernetes
SAFe
LDAP configuration

Title: Software Test Engineer
Description:
At Concordium, we're on a mission to pioneer groundbreaking blockchain technology and shape the digital future where qualities such as compliance, cost efficiency, transparency, accountability, and concern for the environment are in focus.




We are looking for a software test engineer with a strong technical background and a relevant education within IT to join our Tech Team.




As a part of the team in Aarhus, you will help implement the next-generation blockchain technology developed in close cooperation with leading scientists to refine a next-generation open and permissionless blockchain protocol.




You will get the opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies with a wide range of responsibilities through testing both the blockchain itself, the crypto wallets on top and the tooling facilitating it all.




Key responsibilities

Proactive participation in the day-to-day software development process
Active participation in defining test strategies and test plans early in the development cycle
Test execution during feature development and system testing
Bug reporting and assistance in analysis of the issues detected
Writing and maintaining test specifications
Participation in improving test processes as well as test infrastructure




Requirements

Our preferred candidate has the following professional and personal qualifications:




Previous experience working as a software test engineer
Experience in using test scripts and command line tools on a daily basis
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new environments
Experience with test automation is great but not a requirement
Experience in task and bug tracking using e.g. Jira or GitHub
Proactive, Persistent and Detail-oriented
Good cooperation and communication skills
Relevant education within IT
Fluency in spoken and written English




Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have a good understanding of a blockchain, wallets and crypto.




We offer

Work in a great team of highly skilled software developers and testers
The opportunity to work with all aspects of core blockchain technology
A complex, exciting and intellectually challenging environment with the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive every day
A competitive remuneration package




About Concordium

Concordium is deeply rooted in science, and it is the first blockchain with identification of users built into the blockchain protocol thereby contributing to a safer digital world and supporting businesses and other users of the blockchain in meeting current and future regulatory requirements in the crypto space. The Concordium blockchain was successfully launched in June 2021, has since created more than 15 million blocks on the chain, and many companies and projects are currently building on Concordium.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about robotics and eager to shape the future of robot technology? Join Cobot Lift, a fast-growing company specializing in collaborative robots for industries and global airport baggage handling. We are seeking a talented Software Engineer to be part of our innovative team! The position needs to be filled ASAP so we are ONLY looking for candidates who are currently based in Denmark




Responsibilities🎯:

Develop and Design: Create and implement software modules for our robots systems using PLC programming and C++.

Customer Support: Provide remote support and handle customer inquiries to ensure smooth operation of our robots.

Device Management: Oversee the status visualization of devices and manage remote access for troubleshooting.

Field Testing: Travel to customer sites (20-50 days/year) to test, validate, and ensure all software requirements are met and functioning properly




Your Qualifications 🎓:

Proficient in PLC programming.
Has previous experience with robotics or similar fields.
Has documented experience in R&D projects.
Can work effectively in R&D software sprints and meet deadlines.
Is proficient in C++
Is structured and can document code with a focus on license protection.
Has experience working in a small, rapidly growing team.
(Bonus) Experience with PackML.




What we offer💼:

Cobot Lift offers a dynamic work environment where we push the boundaries of what’s possible in the robotics world. Our corporate social responsibility policy ensures we integrate quality, safety, and sustainability into all aspects of our business, creating a better future for society and the planet.

Join us in Slagelse and be part of an exciting company that’s leading innovation in vacuum-based lifting solutions for logistics, agriculture, production companies, and airport baggage handling.

Apply now and help shape the future of robot technology!

Learn more about us at Cobot Lift.

Title: Staff R&D ML/AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description And Requirements

Staff R&D ML/AI Engineer

Develop an ML framework to assist customers in semiconductor process integration and optimization. Joining a dynamic international team you will contribute to the development and deployment of ML solutions for silicon manufacturing.

Physics aware ML models are created using large volumes of measurement data augmented by Technology-CAD (TCAD) simulations.

Duties Include


Analyze and understand the ML solution that works better for a specific application
Integrate the ML solution in the ML framework
Contribute to extend the ML framework and integrate it with TCAD tools
Support AEs to solve the problems that customers report
Contribute to collaborative projects with customers and other partners based on business needs
Develop reusable and testable software components for use in a large existing code base, optimize existing components.


Qualifications


MS or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.
Strong understanding and expertise in ML/AI.
3+ years of hands-on experience in software development.
Solid programming skills in python. C++ is a plus.
Familiarity with Keras/TensorFlow is a plus.
Familiarity with training and operating streaming ML models is required.
Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process is a plus.
Strong desire to learn and explore new technologies.
English language working proficiency and communication skills allowing teamwork in an international environment.
Willingness to work in a distributed international team.


We offer a strong salary including a competitive benefits scheme.

Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance semiconductor chips— faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced semiconductor chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Category

Engineering

Country

Denmark

Job Subcategory

R&D Engineering

Hire Type

Employee

Title: Research Scientist in Metabolic Engineering
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This is a 12 months temporary position.




FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company dedicated to helping growers optimize crop performance sustainably. When addressing tomorrow’s challenges, we believe the status quo is not an option. FMC is committed to developing powerful solutions that are better for the planet than any that currently exists. Our innovative products integrate the best of synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health and nutrition, as well as precision agriculture technologies.




Join our rapidly growing Pheromone Team

We are now looking for a highly motivated Research Scientist to join our Discovery and Design Team at FMC’s Pheromones Plant Health Division. Join us and become part of a team that's dedicated to making a real difference in the world. We develop cutting-edge pheromone products designed to control insect pests in an environmentally friendly way.

With our supportive culture and commitment to employee growth and development, you'll have the opportunity to learn, grow, and advance your career. We will do our best to support you to reach your full potential. With a positive mindset and a can-do attitude, we know you'll be an inspiration to those around you, driving our team to achieve even greater heights.

The Pheromones Team is currently based in Central Copenhagen but is expected to move into new laboratories at our European Innovation Center in Hørsholm, Denmark in 2025.




About The Job

In the Discovery and Design Team you’ll take on a key role in developing microbial production strains for industrial fermentation processes. Our tasks cover early discovery projects establishing microbial production of new compounds as well as development projects to enable cost effective biomanufacturing.

You’ll fit right into our team if science, innovation, and a dynamic workday are your main motivators as well as personal interactions with colleagues from different disciplines.

Your main responsibilities will be:

Genetic design and construction of microbial strains to optimize production of chemicals
To draft and execute the experimental designs
Thorough recording and evaluation of experimental data
To review and evaluate the academic literature and patent landscape
To support IP filings




With safety being one of FMC’s top priorities you are expected to “think safe” and follow our high safety procedures and standards.




Qualifications

We are looking for a team player who’ll thrive in a give-and-take environment where we together create results. As you'll be collaborating with many internal departments, good communications, intercultural and interpersonal skills are required.




The ideal candidate brings the following experiences and qualifications to the role:

You hold a PhD Degree in Metabolic Engineering, Molecular Biology or Microbiology; or MSc degree with 5+ years of industrial experience in a relevant field
You possess a good understanding of microbial physiology and/or metabolic engineering
You are a curious out-of-the box thinker with a technical mindset and a constructive hands-on attitude.
Juggling multiple projects at the same time comes natural to you
You are a pragmatic perfectionist who can draw the line at “good enough”
You like to take on challenges and responsibilities and do it with pride in a good job done, be it of practical or of theoretical nature
You are comfortable with English being the main work-language at FMC




Are you interested?

If you are convinced that you can make a difference in this position and share our commitment to diversity, collaboration and quality, we look forward to receiving your application documents.




We take candidates into the recruitment process continuously and fill the position once we have found the right candidate.




We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Senior Algo Developer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Senior Algo Developer

Combine your technical skills to craft trading solutions alongside our traders, software engineers and quantitative analysts.

In helping build a more automated, data-driven, scalable and future proof trading environment, you’ll quickly become a leading part of a team where lending a helping hand, trusting in each other’s expertise, and encouraging each other’s ideas and suggestions is paramount.




The role

Create innovative frameworks and state-of-the-art quantitative trading models.
Participate in the full life-cycle workflow, from hypothesis formulation, research and prototyping through to production release.
Develop and execute data-driven strategies in the power markets.
Recognise and understand market patterns.

You will need to have:

Educational background within math, physics, computer science, statistics, econometrics or similar. Preferably to Masters or PhD level.
Experience building advanced statistical models.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Demonstrable exposure to profitable quantitative strategies.
Minimal of 3 years’ experience with quantitative trading.
Solid numerical programming experience in Python (or similar).
Full professional proficiency in English – both written and verbal.
Experience within the energy trading sector is a plus.

About you

A strong analytical and solution-based thinker.
Commercially-minded and results-oriented.
Resourceful, creative, adaptable, risk tolerant, stress resistant.
A good communicator, comfortable mentoring and coaching.
Able to work together in a team on trading strategy.
High level of personal integrity.
View problems as opportunities to grow.
Enjoy intellectually stimulating challenges and testing new ideas.




What we offer

Partnership Potential with a clear road to an equity stake in the company!
Flexible working hours – option to work 1 or 2 days per week from home.
Paid home office internet and equipment.
Paid pension, health care and insurance package.
Uncapped bonus scheme.
A competitive reward package and share scheme.




Contact:




Apply on Linkedin or to our careers email.

Careers@cacommodities.dk

If you wish to discus the position contact our Head of Algo Trading, Rasmus at:

rfe@cacommodities.dk

Title: AI/ML-ingeniør
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi har en spændende mulighed for en AI/ML-ingeniør til at slutte sig til vores voksende ingeniørteam. Bliv en del af udviklingen i miljø- og sundhedssektoren, hvor du bidrager til livreddende rapporteringsapps og udforsker innovative løsninger. Denne rolle giver rig mulighed for karriereudvikling i takt med, at RHE Global vokser.

Din rolle og indflydelse

Som AI/ML-ingeniør Vil Du Få En Afgørende Rolle i At Præge Vores Produktportfolio Og Sikre, At Vi Lever Op Til Vores Sektors Voksende Forventninger Til AI. Hvis Du Brænder For Kunstig Intelligens Og For At Udvikle Banebrydende Løsninger Omkring Lydbaserede Datasæt, Vil Vi Gerne Høre Fra Dig. Du Vil Blive Involveret i


Definering af AI/ML-strategien for virksomheden sammen med vores ledende ingeniør og CTO
Indsamling af krav fra et tværfunktionelt team og sikring af, at leveringen er realistisk
Udvikle produktionsklare maskinlæringsmodeller og -algoritmer
Opbygning af arkitekturer til dyb læring (DL)
Designe de nyeste lydbaserede applikationer drevet af AI


Hvad vi leder efter


Dokumenteret erfaring med at levere maskinlæringsmodeller til produktion
Erfaring med cloud-baserede AI/ML-tjenester såsom AWS SageMaker
Erfaring med at opbygge AI/ML-arkitekturer fra start til levering
Erfaring med sprogteknologiske (NLP) værktøjer og teknikker
Erfaring med big data-værktøjer og -teknologier
Interesse for at arbejde med lydbaserede datasæt og dyb læring (DL)
Erfaring med idéudvikling, prototyper og validering af arbejde
Solid erfaring med softwareudvikling og general best practice
Interesse i at bidrage til en teamkultur med kontinuerlig læring og forbedring


Krav til dig


Du skal have mindst 4 års erfaring i en lignende rolle og være baseret i København, Danmark. Bemærk venligst, at det primære arbejdssprog i jobbet vil være engelsk.

Title: Fullstack Developer for AI/ML and Platform Engineering
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Ønskeskyen/GoWish:

At Ønskeskyen, with our international app platform GoWish, we've revolutionized the way users create, share, and fulfill wish lists for life's memorable moments, from weddings and birthdays to Christmas and everything in between. As a leader in digital gifting, we connect millions of users worldwide, providing a platform for thoughtful gifting and celebrating special occasions. Our technology-driven approach, focusing on user engagement and innovative solutions, makes us a pioneer in the gifting ecosystem.




Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Fullstack Developer with a strong focus on AI/ML solutions and platform engineering. In this role, you will work with data scientists to prototype and deploy solutions into production, while also focusing on platform scalability, big data management, and providing the best developer experience.




Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate closely with data scientists and machine learning engineers to understand AI/ML requirements and translate them into scalable, production-ready applications.
Develop full stack prototypes and production code for AI/ML solutions, including both front-end interfaces and back-end services.
Implement robust APIs and web services to serve AI/ML models at high QPS and throughput.
Ensure the seamless integration of AI/ML models into existing applications and systems, focusing on platform scalability and performance.
Optimize and monitor AI/ML model performance in production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to maintain high-quality code standards.
Provide expertise in big data technologies and tools to handle large-scale data processing for real time applications.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in full stack development technologies that relate to AI/ML.




Key Requirements:
Front-end Development: Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript.
Experience with modern front-end frameworks such as React.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles.
Back-end Development: Strong understanding of server-side programming languages such as Node.js, Python (Django, Flask), or Go.
Experience with building and consuming RESTful APIs and web services.
Knowledge of database systems (SQL and NoSQL) and experience with data modeling and management.
AI and Machine Learning:Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and familiarity with ML frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Ability to work with ML engineer, data scientists to implement and optimize AI/ML models.
Basic understanding on data processing libraries and tools (Pandas, NumPy, Apache Spark).
Deployment and Infrastructure:Proficient experience with cloud platforms (GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes or similar).
Expert in CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (Git).
Expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform.
GitOps practices and tooling.
Platform Engineering:Expertise in designing and maintaining scalable platforms to support AI/ML solutions.
Strong understanding of micro-services architecture and distributed systems.
Promote developer experience to generate high quality software and development workflow.
Ensure observability in data and AI solutions.




Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in the e-commerce or related industry.
Knowledge of A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.
Familiarity with big data technologies and distributed systems.




How You Can Help Data Scientists and ML Engineers:
Provide technical guidance and support in translating data science and AI prototypes into scalable production solutions.
Develop robust and scalable APIs and services to facilitate seamless integration of AI/ML models into the platform.
Optimize model performance and ensure reliable deployment in real-time and batch processing environments.
Collaborate on building automated data pipelines for efficient data processing and model training.
Implement observability tool stack to ensure the health and performance of deployed models.




Join Us:

If you are passionate about AI, machine learning, fullstack development, and platform engineering, and want to make a significant impact in the digital gifting space, we would love to hear from you. Join Ønskeskyen and help us shape the future of thoughtful gifting and celebration.




How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications, and any relevant portfolio or GitHub links.

  • Optimize model performance and ensure reliable deployment in real-time and batch processing environments.
  • Collaborate on building automated data pipelines for efficient data processing and model training.
  • Implement observability tool stack to ensure the health and performance of deployed models.


Join Us:

If you are passionate about AI, machine learning, fullstack development, and platform engineering, and want to make a significant impact in the digital gifting space, we would love to hear from you. Join Ønskeskyen and help us shape the future of thoughtful gifting and celebration.


How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications, and any relevant portfolio or GitHub links.

Title: Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled data scientist with a strong background in machine learning and deep learning methods to drive the development our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.

This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately a better global usage of limited resources.




Primary tasks

Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for all steps of the data analysis. You will work in close collaboration with our software algorithm team, hardware team and marketing organization in taking the data analysis chain from concept to deployment and sales release.

Your responsibilities will be to:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets
Develop the algorithms and data pipelines
Design experiments to test the data analysis chain
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms




Your daily work will be at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød, Denmark




About you

You hold an M.Sc. or preferably a Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:




Expertise in using Python and libraries such as pandas and NumPy
Strong experience in training of machine learning models using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Knowledge on best practices for ML development
Understanding of image analysis and computer vision libraries such as OpenCV
Experience with development pipelines in cloud services such as Azure, AWS, or tools such as MLflow or are willing to learn
Understanding on how to optimize deep learning models for deployment on edge devices is a plus

We expect you to have an interest in:




The data analysis chain of analytical instrument
Exploration of data in problem solving
Developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain




As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You are curious on new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.




We offer

We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D and work closely together with universities. FOSS is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strive at delivering cutting-edge creative and robust algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal tone.




Application

Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, so apply now - better today than tomorrow! Any questions can be directed to Senior Scientist Erik Schou Dreier (+45 4063 8708 or esd@foss.dk) or Director Lars Nørgaard (+45 2761 6958 or lno@foss.dk).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.




FOSS

Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects it has on climate change.

FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40,000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety, and securing fair payment.

Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1,700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.

Apply for job as Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision in R&D

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This role offers a diverse and challenging role, tackling various tasks for different companies using multiple technologies. You will build data pipelines and deploy machine learning solutions, collaborating closely with data scientists and solution managers.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain APIs
Manage cloud setups and DevOps
Analyze customer IT systems for ML solution integration
Create ML pipelines to integrate ML services into IT systems

Required Qualifications

Experience deploying machine learning models
Proficiency in Python
Professional proficiency in Danish

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with various database types (relational, graph, NoSQL, document)
Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure)
Background in software development or data engineering

Personal Attributes

Strong communication skills with customers and stakeholders
Independent and quick to learn new technologies and solve problems
Business-oriented with an interest in the interaction between software and business value
Team player who values cooperation and knowledge sharing

Please send over your CV and this will be reviewed immediately


Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Lead Data & AI Scientist
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by productionizing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions?




Join our Advanced Analytics & AI team to help improve and grow our data science portfolio – and become one of the leading minds behind ECCO’s future setup for advanced analytics. Making your mark on data science at ECCO, you will help empower business units to make data-driven decisions and even automate operations.




Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead the data science initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how ECCO operates based on data. This means working with the entire value chain – from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing and store operations.




As a Lead Data Scientist, you will develop, implement and deliver complex solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. Using DevOps and DataOps pipelines, you will deploy and maintain solutions, and you will:




Be a leading mind in the Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely together with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Scope and develop new data science products, e.g. for price optimisation, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare and synthesise data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised and re-enforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform that is delivered by the Data Platform team




You enjoy applying analytics to real-life business challenges

While self-driven and resourceful, you enjoy working in teams to solve challenges and develop the best solutions. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimisation and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.




You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working – and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:




Hold a master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. statistics, mathematics, engineering or operation research
Have significant experience as a Senior Data Scientist or an equivalent quantitative role with a strong focus on statistics
Have significant experience using data science/database software and programming languages, such as SQL, R and Python
Have experience with unified analytics engines such as Apache Spark and Databricks, as well as with container platform/orchestration systems such as Docker/Kubernetes
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus.




We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with 30+ highly skilled, motivated, collaborative and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.




We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this development.




Are you ready for your next challenge?

We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply. Due to the summer holidays, the application deadline for this position is August 2nd, 2024. We plan to have the first calls with candidates in the second half of August.




For additional information, you can reach out to Head of Advanced Analytics & AI, Thomas Jauho THJAU@ecco.com.




Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on https://enter.ecco.com.




CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.




Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.




Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science Team in ROCKWOOL HQ in Hedehusene. In this job, you can expect to travel about 10% of the time in support of global projects.

Ready to help build a better future for generations to come?

In an ever-changing, fast paced world, we owe it to ourselves and our future generations to live life responsibly. At ROCKWOOL, we work relentlessly to enrich modern living through our innovative stone wool solutions.

Your future team

We have recently started a journey towards using more digitalization and automation and better use of data – and this is where your abilities come into play. You will join our Data Science team and work at the forefront of machine learning and artificial intelligence.

What You Will Be Doing

As our new Senior Data Scientist with expertise in developing AI solutions in a manufacturing context, you will be responsible for developing advanced Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) models and algorithms that can be applied to real-world manufacturing data sets. The primary focus is to leverage data to drive innovation, optimize operations, and improve quality control in our products and manufacturing processes.

In addition, we have initiated our GenAI journey and are currently working on our internal and safe-to use GenAI product. We utilize LLMs, Azure OpenAI, custom RAG framework, Langchain and several other tools and packages in the GenAI space to build our GenAI product. We anticipate the Senior Data Scientist will make vital contributions towards this initiative too.

This is the responsibilities :

Develop and deploy AI/ML models


Develop and apply models to manufacturing sensor data, including image recognition and computer vision techniques, to enhance quality control and productivity in our manufacturing process
Use Azure OpenAI, LLMs, vector databases, Langchain and several other services and packages to develop custom GenAI solutions



Follow Machine Learning processes and Best Practices


Develop and maintain best practices and standards for carrying out Data Science projects
Implement Machine Learning Ops practices to streamline the development, deployment, and maintenance of models in production
Collaboration with the team in identifying areas for improvement and recommend strategies to enhance the data science function in our organization



Ensure collaboration and stakeholder management


Work with process engineers to understand the data generated by sensors and translate that into actionable insights
Collaborate with Data engineers to identify data sources and develop efficient data pipeline strategies
Collaborate with colleagues from the business in establishing metrics and understanding requirements
Aid your team to extend their services into newer business areas



Stay up to date with latest technologies in AI/ML domain


Ensure continuous learning and development
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Data Science to ensure that our practices are cutting-edge



What You Bring


A master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years of experience in Data Science and it would be great if you have experience with either the manufacturing industry or with GenAI
Noteworthy experience in computer vision and image recognition techniques, such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or scikit-image
Experience of working with LLMs, transformer models, vector databases, RAG frameworks, Langchain, etc.
You have already experience working with manufacturing sensor data, including signal processing and time-series analysis
Excellent skills within Python, R, SQL, and cloud computing technologies
Hands on experience in deploying models and algorithms into production systems is desirable
Experience with ML Ops tools and frameworks such as Kubeflow, MLflow, e.g. is desirable
Professional in English language



As a person you are curious and solution oriented. You can easily communicate complex content across functions and to non-technical colleagues. And you have a structured way of working forward and take pride in delivering high quality output.

ROCKWOOL are keen to nurture employees develop their talents and move forward in their careers. You can expect to be supported in your professional ambitions through our programs, to help you reach your professional goals.

Ready to apply?

If you want to know more, please contact Senior Data Scientist Shabab Akhter, shabab.akhter@rockwool.com. Please submit your CV and motivational letter before July 21 2024.

Who We Are

We are the world leader in stone wool solutions. Founded in 1937 in Denmark, we transform volcanic rock into safe, sustainable products that help people and communities thrive. We are a global company with more than 12,000 employees, located in 40+ countries with 51 manufacturing facilities, all focused on one common purpose – to release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.

Sustainability is central to our business strategy. ROCKWOOL was one of the first companies to commit to actively contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) framework and are actively committed to 11 SDGs, including SDG 14, Life Below Water. Through our partnership with the One Ocean Foundation and in connection with our sponsorship of the Denmark SailGP team, we will help raise awareness around ocean health challenges in an effort to accelerate solutions to protect it.

Diverse and Inclusive Culture

We want all our people to feel valued, respected, included and heard. We employ 79 different nationalities worldwide and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees, promote diversity, and work against all forms of discrimination among ROCKWOOL employees.

Title: Data Scientist med IT flair
Description:
YouSee søger en dygtig Data Scientist til vores team Digital Excellence i Aarhus under afdelingen Digital Service. Afdelingens mål er at digitalisere kunderejsen på tværs af vores kanaler og sikre den gode kundeoplevelse. I vores afdeling er vi ikke underlagt at arbejde med bestemte værktøjer. Tværtimod tager vi selv ansvaret for at benytte de løsninger og redskaber, vi vurderer bedst til at løse de problemstillinger, vi bliver mødt med.

Din rolle og dine opgaver:

Din primære opgave vil være at anvende ML til at forbedre interne og eksterne processer. Du vil arbejde med de nyeste ML-felter, som f.eks. LLM/RAG, hvor du løbende tilegner dig ny viden og sætter ML i en forretningsmæssig kontekst, der skaber værdi.

Din rolle vil være at medvirke til øget kvalitet og struktur i alle de essentielle dele af et ML/ETL setup, herunder:


Optimering af chatbot RAG (udvikles i Cognigy Omnichannel Agent Platform).
Sikre integration mellem systemer i forbindelse med ML projekter.
Udvikle og integrere kreative og skalérbare ML løsninger ud fra eksisterende teknologier.
Navigere i et bredt landskab af IT-løsninger, som du selv er med til definere.
Præsentation af resultater og anbefalinger.



I dine opgaver kan du se frem til både at arbejde på tværs af afdelinger og på tværs af digitale og analoge kanaler. Du vil med tiden få ansvaret for både små og store data- og analyseprojekter. Disse projekter skal bære præg af en forståelse for forretningen, så der sikres værdi.

Din person:

Som Data Scientist vil du ofte blive mødt af en konkret forretningsproblematik. Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:


Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
Visionær med åbent sind.
Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.



Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:


Udvikling i Python
Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
Backend-udvikling
IT-principper/økosystemer
REST API



Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2024.

Kontaktperson: Director Lars Ørnholt Kier, mobil: 21642185 (i ugerne 28-30 kontaktes Data Scientist Kristian Kristensen, mobil 42451206)

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere


Show more
HTML:
YouSee søger en dygtig Data Scientist til vores team Digital Excellence i Aarhus under afdelingen Digital Service. Afdelingens mål er at digitalisere kunderejsen på tværs af vores kanaler og sikre den gode kundeoplevelse. I vores afdeling er vi ikke underlagt at arbejde med bestemte værktøjer. Tværtimod tager vi selv ansvaret for at benytte de løsninger og redskaber, vi vurderer bedst til at løse de problemstillinger, vi bliver mødt med.

Din rolle og dine opgaver:

Din primære opgave vil være at anvende ML til at forbedre interne og eksterne processer. Du vil arbejde med de nyeste ML-felter, som f.eks. LLM/RAG, hvor du løbende tilegner dig ny viden og sætter ML i en forretningsmæssig kontekst, der skaber værdi.

Din rolle vil være at medvirke til øget kvalitet og struktur i alle de essentielle dele af et ML/ETL setup, herunder:

  • Optimering af chatbot RAG (udvikles i Cognigy Omnichannel Agent Platform).
  • Sikre integration mellem systemer i forbindelse med ML projekter.
  • Udvikle og integrere kreative og skalérbare ML løsninger ud fra eksisterende teknologier.
  • Navigere i et bredt landskab af IT-løsninger, som du selv er med til definere.
  • Præsentation af resultater og anbefalinger.


I dine opgaver kan du se frem til både at arbejde på tværs af afdelinger og på tværs af digitale og analoge kanaler. Du vil med tiden få ansvaret for både små og store data- og analyseprojekter. Disse projekter skal bære præg af en forståelse for forretningen, så der sikres værdi.

Din person:

Som Data Scientist vil du ofte blive mødt af en konkret forretningsproblematik. Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:

  • Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
  • Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
  • Visionær med åbent sind.
  • Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
  • Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.


Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:

  • Udvikling i Python
  • Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
  • Backend-udvikling
  • IT-principper/økosystemer
  • REST API


Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Introduction

Nabla Ventures is a small quantitative energy trading company located in the heart of Aarhus, Denmark. Our team consists of economists and software developers dedicated to short-term energy trading in US markets, leveraging machine learning models. 




We seek a talented Software Developer to join us and expand our technical setup further. 




Your tasks will be dynamic and can be tailored to your preferences and capabilities. Examples of your tasks could include developing ETL pipelines, front-end development, or designing deep learning models.




Your skill set and experience

Experience with Cloud Computing and MLOps
Fluent in Python and preferably experienced in Django
Quantitative modeling capabilities are a plus but not necessary
Can work independently




About us

Nabla Ventures, established in late 2021, specializes in trading short-term energy across most US power markets. Our team comprises individuals with economics and computer science backgrounds operating in a fully automated trading environment — there are no manual traders here. We prioritize freedom and work-life balance, fostering a positive atmosphere and flexible work schedules. Despite our small size, our team has demonstrated a proven track record. 

At Nabla Ventures, every team member is entrusted with significant responsibility from the start, offering numerous opportunities to grow within their role. Our environment allows professionals to thrive with the autonomy to work when it best fits their schedules.




We do not aim to become a large corporation. Instead, we prefer to stay a tight-knit, skilled team focused on perfecting our automated energy trading systems. Keeping things small makes us agile, innovative, and closely connected. We value each team member's expertise, working together to improve our technology and processes continually. We aim to stay at the cutting edge of automated trading while enjoying the benefits of a collaborative, supportive work environment.




Practicalities

Start Date: As soon as possible
Location: In-person at our office in Aarhus or partly remote
Compensation: Competitive salary with potential for bonuses and/or company shares
Working Hours: Flexible, but mostly in regular office hours.




Contact us

If you are a good match for this position, please send your application, including a CV, to info@nablatech.net. We look forward to hearing from you.




If you have any questions, please contact Thomas Hoffmann Nielsen at thomas@nablatech.net

Title: AI Application Engineer
Description:
Join our pioneering team at BESTSELLER as we embrace the power of data science and AI to redefine the retail and e-commerce landscape. We seek an experienced AI Application Engineer passionate about harnessing data for innovation. This role places you at the forefront of our APPRETIO platform, our dedication to revolutionizing merchandising through data-driven solutions.

YOUR NEW ROLE

As a key player in the APPRETIO team, you'll lead the development of interactive AI solutions, the backbone of our data-driven decision-making. Collaborating with top-tier data scientists, engineers, and analysts, you'll work closely with various business stakeholders. Your challenge? To revolutionize our data usage and redefine our business strategy and operations.

YOUR TEAM

You will join the dynamic Data & Analytics department, a vibrant community of over 50 professionals passionate about driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. Embedded in a product team of ten top-tier professionals, you will leverage data to enhance customer experiences, optimize operations, and drive revenue growth - all while upholding the highest standards of customer satisfaction and quality.

YOUR IMPACT

In your capacity as an AI Application Engineer, you will:


Design and execute machine learning services within a top AI delivery team.
Engage in application development and data science experimentation to maximize consumer value, satisfaction, and quality.
Utilize the latest tools such as Python, Pytorch, Kubernetes, Plotly Dash, Databricks, MLFlow, and Snowflake to build and sustain robust applications.
Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences and successful feature implementation.
Monitor, debug, and optimize machine learning models and applications to enhance performance, scalability, and reliability.


Your Benefits

This role offers a dynamic and challenging environment where quick, impactful decisions are the norm. You will:


Join a diverse and expert team in a supportive, inclusive, and dynamic work environment that values collaboration and innovation.
Advance your career with extensive professional growth opportunities, including leadership development, specialized training programs, and international project exposure.
Access dedicated training, educational programs, and a pathway to various certifications.


YOUR PROFILE

You are an energetic, proactive team player, motivated by utilizing data and turning it into intelligent applications. You can recognize yourself in most of the following statements:


PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related fields.
Advanced Python proficiency and a robust interest in machine learning and predictive modeling.
Solid understanding of the statistical and algorithmic foundations of machine learning.
Proven experience deploying AI applications in production settings.
Excellent communication skills, delivering effective technical presentations to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in agile environments and a proactive, solution-focused approach to tasks.
English fluency, both spoken and written.


The following qualifications would also be an advantage:


Proficiency in Plotly Dash, cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure), and database management systems (SQL, NoSQL).
Experience with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, and developing/maintaining production-grade web applications.
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.


WORK LOCATION

Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

To make sure you're in the running, please send your application and CV by July 12th. We review candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the job ad when we have found the right candidate. For inquiries about the position, please contact Emil Hartvig Pedersen at +45 29628203. We can't wait to hear from you!

About Bestseller

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 20,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.

Title: Exciting Opportunity: Fullstack Developer!
Description:
Exciting Opportunity: Fullstack developer

Join us in Aarhus and be part of the development of innovative solutions for processing vast amounts of weather measurements, satellite image data, soil analysis, and farm machine data. 

From concept to production, you'll play a pivotal role in creating scalable software that contributes to a better environment and climate.




About the Role:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Fullstack Developer with a strong proficiency in UI/UX design and implementation, and solid experience in scalable backend development.




Your Responsibilities:
Collaborate with product managers and team to mockup UI/UX wireframes
Develop and maintain user-facing features using modern frontend technologies such as React.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Implement and adhere to best practices for coding, testing, and performance.
Develop and maintain core features in our backend utilizing technologies such as Kotlin, NodeJS, Java and Python.
Develop and maintain RESTful APIs for internal and external usage




About you:
Master or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
Proven experience with frontend technologies such as, but not limited to, React.
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Have knowledge of and can apply best practices for UI/UX.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs and asynchronous request handling.
Knowledge of version control systems, preferably Git.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.




About the Team:

This venture is a collaboration between Cordulus and Danish Agro, with your team based at Agro Food Park, Aarhus N alongside Cordulus. At Cordulus, you'll join a vibrant team of 25 colleagues, including developers and R&D researchers.




Technologies You'll Work With:

Our backend utilizes Kotlin, Node.js, and Python, hosted on AWS, leveraging services like EC2, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, RDS, SNS, and SQS. The frontend is powered by React.js, communicating with the backend via its REST API, also hosted on AWS. We manage our codebases on GitHub and streamline our processes with GitHub Actions and Terraform.




We Offer:
An exhilarating and stimulating role in a dynamic startup environment.
Social events with colleagues, diverse lunch options, and burger days.
Competitive salary and benefits package aligned with market standards.




Excited to Join Us?

Apply now to join our team and help shape the future of agricultural technology. Interviews are ongoing, and we're eager to hear from you! Contact Søren Pedersen to hear more about the role by or send your application to sop@cordulus.com

Title: Test Engineer
Description:
Test and Systems Engineer

Do you have experience with testing electrical hardware as well as software? Do you have a proactive approach to testing and development? Can you see yourself being part of a core team developing an electrical pitch system? Then this job at Emerson in Rødkærsbro might be right for you.




On behalf of Emerson, we are looking for a Test and Systems Engineer to join their team in Rødkærsbro. Your main responsibilities will include testing both hardware and software for the electrical pitch system, as well as working on pitch system-related projects and testing new sub-supplier products.




Some of your responsibilities will include:




Performing tests and verification according to the relevant standards
Error correction and design updates in cooperation with the design team
Reviewing specifications and documentation
Supporting the organization and supplier reviews
Providing on-site support and commissioning when needed




At the moment, there are some very exciting development projects in the pipeline, so you should expect some ad-hoc assignments in the team.




The person we are looking for

We are looking for an experienced test engineer who also thrives in a systems/development role. Your key function will be within the test environment; however, you will be working very closely with the design engineers.




We are looking for someone who has:




A relevant background in electronics or IT
Experience with electrical hardware and software testing
Knowledge and some experience with Python, C++, and Test Link (or a similar Test Management System)
A good overall understanding and knowledge of electrical components




You should be aware that there will be some travel activity in this job – up to 30 days/year. Additionally, you should probably not have a fear of heights, as some of the travel activities will be to sites around the world.

Your primary work location will be in Rødkærsbro, with the opportunity to work from home some days after a thorough introduction to the product and company.




What now

Actief-Hartmanns is supporting Emerson with this recruitment. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Jørn Emil Stochholm Sørensen at joern.soerensen@actief-hartmanns.dk (summer vacation in weeks 28-29-30).




About Emerson

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!

  • Knowledge and some experience with Python, C++, and Test Link (or a similar Test Management System)
  • A good overall understanding and knowledge of electrical components


You should be aware that there will be some travel activity in this job – up to 30 days/year. Additionally, you should probably not have a fear of heights, as some of the travel activities will be to sites around the world.

Your primary work location will be in Rødkærsbro, with the opportunity to work from home some days after a thorough introduction to the product and company.


What now

Actief-Hartmanns is supporting Emerson with this recruitment. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Jørn Emil Stochholm Sørensen at joern.soerensen@actief-hartmanns.dk (summer vacation in weeks 28-29-30).


About Emerson

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about robotics and eager to shape the future of robot technology? Join Cobot Lift, a fast-growing company specializing in collaborative robots for industries and global airport baggage handling. We are seeking a talented Software Engineer to be part of our innovative team! The position needs to be filled ASAP so we are ONLY looking for candidates who are currently based in Denmark




Responsibilities🎯:

Develop and Design: Create and implement software modules for our robots systems using PLC programming and C++.

Customer Support: Provide remote support and handle customer inquiries to ensure smooth operation of our robots.

Device Management: Oversee the status visualization of devices and manage remote access for troubleshooting.

Field Testing: Travel to customer sites (20-50 days/year) to test, validate, and ensure all software requirements are met and functioning properly




Your Qualifications 🎓:

Proficient in PLC programming.
Has previous experience with robotics or similar fields.
Has documented experience in R&D projects.
Can work effectively in R&D software sprints and meet deadlines.
Is proficient in C++
Is structured and can document code with a focus on license protection.
Has experience working in a small, rapidly growing team.
(Bonus) Experience with PackML.




What we offer💼:

Cobot Lift offers a dynamic work environment where we push the boundaries of what’s possible in the robotics world. Our corporate social responsibility policy ensures we integrate quality, safety, and sustainability into all aspects of our business, creating a better future for society and the planet.

Join us in Slagelse and be part of an exciting company that’s leading innovation in vacuum-based lifting solutions for logistics, agriculture, production companies, and airport baggage handling.

Apply now and help shape the future of robot technology!

Learn more about us at Cobot Lift.
